http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DVVN8zGEacio

We're a go on the shutdown.  Could last hours, could last weeks; we won't k=
now until it's over.

If anyone has any questions about the shutdown, drop by EH1.  Those of us w=
ho've been following the process will answer in as factual a way as possibl=
e.

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Christopher Joyce
Sent: Monday, September 30, 2013 11:08 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Government shutdown

For those of you who don't know, there's a high chance that the federal gov=
ernment shuts down in 1 hour.  This is a kind of big deal, and has pretty f=
ar-reaching effects on our country, our economy, and many Americans employe=
d by the government.

So, to (celebrate/observe/commiserate) this occurrence, we'll be watching a=
n episode of the West Wing that deals with government shutdowns in EH1 at m=
idnight, assuming the shutdown goes through.  The West Wing is an older (ea=
rly 2000s) TV show written by Aaron Sorkin which depicts a much less dysfun=
ctional government than the one we actually have these days.  It's a great =
show for anyone who's got even a passing interest in politics.

If the government does shut down, bring a snack, a beverage, and some work;=
 then congregate in EH1 to watch a TV show that does a fairly good job of r=
epresenting the process of a government shutdown.  The West Wing does a gre=
at job of adding a layer of understandability to a process that's pretty op=
aque sometimes.

Do your duty, be an informed citizen, and watch a pretty damn good TV show =
for a study break while you're at it.

-Chris

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C8749EXVS01oline_

From Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct  1 13:58:00 2013
From: Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu (Molly L. Farison)
Date: Tue, 1 Oct 2013 13:58:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Design!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C8571@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C8571@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C89C8@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C89C8EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

User visit got moved to Monday 1-4pm.  Let me know if you'd like to join!
~Molly

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Molly L. Farison
Sent: Monday, September 30, 2013 8:46 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Design!

What are you doing from 1-4pm tomorrow? Nothing important? Pass No Record? =
Come with me on a user visit!

What does that mean, you underclasspeople say? A user visit is a vital part=
 of User-Oriented Collaborative Design (the UOCD class at Olin) where you a=
ctually talk to the group of people that you're designing something for. Yo=
u come in with an open mind, observe what they do, and ask them open-ended =
questions that help you learn more about whether your ideas actually jive w=
ith their needs and values.

The startup I'm currently starting with Amos, Lilypad Scales, is making a s=
cale for people in wheelchairs to weigh themselves at home (an idea that ca=
me out of UOCD, from talking to lots of people in wheelchairs). Tomorrow, I=
 will be taking our current "feels-like" prototype to Spaulding Rehab Hospi=
tal in Cambridge, where my friend Dave and a few other people in wheelchair=
s will be trying out the scale. I plan to watch them roll onto it and roll =
off, then ask whether it was easy to roll on and roll off and whether it fe=
lt safe to do so. Those will be two criteria later on that potential custom=
ers will probably use to determine whether they want to buy the scale and w=
hether it's worth the money at the proposed price. I'll ask them some quest=
ions about what price seems appropriate too.

Come with me! I need to carry two medium-heavy things to successfully do th=
is user visit, and it'll be really interesting, especially if you've never =
met a person who uses a wheelchair before and/or you haven't taken UOCD yet=
. There's plenty to learn.

Let me know if you'd like to join!

~Molly

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C89C8EXVS01oline_

From Joshua.Furnish at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct  1 14:26:29 2013
From: Joshua.Furnish at students.olin.edu (Joshua Furnish)
Date: Tue, 1 Oct 2013 14:26:29 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Wanted: Habitat for Humanity Spring Break Trip assistant
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C8A10@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130212C8A10EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tl;dr: Well, you're not the right person for the job anyways. Don't worry a=
bout it.

The full version:  As you may know, every year a group of Oliner's particip=
ates in the H4H Collegiate Challenge, where we spend our Spring Break helpi=
ng build / repair ~1 home(s). It's a great time, a chance to get off campus=
 for a week and spend time with Oliner's from the different classes/majors.=
 Tis super rewarding to work with your hands and see the progress you (we) =
can make in a week, for the benefit of a family. Point is, I've been on the=
 trip twice, last year I was one of the co-organizers/coordinators/trip-lea=
ders/whatever title makes sense. This year (spring 2014) I will be the trip=
 leader, and I'm looking for someone to work with me and  can take up the m=
antle next year (spring 2015), 'cause I'm a senior...
Wanted:

*         a freshmen or sophomore preferred, maybe-possibly a junior

*         someone who is organized and timely, communicative, sociable, pat=
ient, adaptable, willing to do paperwork & logistics

*         excited about Habitat for Humanity!! Intends to attend both this =
year and next!

*         Wants to work with/assist Joshua Furnish. ('cause if you despise =
me, we probably won't make a great team, lol...)

*         Has the time to put in a few hours here & there this semester (we=
 start setting up the trip in October!); and will consistently have ~1hr/we=
ek next semester

That's the best explanation I can muster via a blanket email, ping me if yo=
u  have questions, and let me know if you're interested in the position!
-Joshua

Due to conflicts with first-year courses, meetings will now be Wednesdays 6=
:30-7:30 in EH1.
iCal attached.

From: David Pudlo
Sent: Monday, September 30, 2013 1:42 PM
To: grow at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [GrOW] New Weekly Meeting!

Tl;dr: We're meeting Wednesdays 5-6 in EH1 to work on initiatives. No more =
Friday meetings.

Ntl;r:                      We're changing the plan for the weekly meetings=
!
                First of all, meetings will now be Wednesdays 6:30-7:30 in =
EH1. We wanted to make the meeting time and place more convenient, and in a=
 more conversational space than a classroom. There will be no more Friday m=
eetings (cancel that iCal of yours!).

                Second of all, meetings will now be focused more on getting=
 things done instead of discussion based. We'll actually be working on init=
iatives to make Olin and the world a better place. This Wednesday we're goi=
ng to split up into three groups:


*        Dining Hall Initiatives: let's reduce the impact of the food we ea=
t at Olin.

*        Solar Initiatives: Let's get significant solar energy here at Olin=
.

*        Gardening Initiatives: Let's work on growing things here at Olin.

Each of these initiatives have efforts started and work that needs to be do=
ne. These are projects that hit at real issues that we can have a real impa=
ct with. We are going to actively make the world a better place, and we wan=
t you to help us.

Send me an email if you have any questions/are curious about an initiative.
-David

ass=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in'>-David<o:p></o:p></p></div></bod=
y></html>=

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Robot and Frank<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3D9j=
ZlSfsE730>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CEBEBE.618A7290]

Robot & Frank (not to be confused with Robot Anne Frank which yields surpri=
singly few Google results) is about an elderly man whose son buys him a dom=
estic robot to take care of him in his old age. This is a sweet quirky movi=
e, but don't expect it to be very happy.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, How are there no images of Robot Anne Frank?
Mariko Thorbecke, Potstickers
Philicia Chow, Key Grip

@font-face
	{font-family:Tahoma;
	panose-1:2 11 6 4 3 5 4 4 2 4;}
/* Style Definitions */

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

Hey guys,

This Saturday Man Hall is throwing our first party of the year and we'd lov=

le drivers.

The details are as follows:
Two shifts: 10PM - 12AM and 1AM - 3AM.
Pay: $10/hr as well as $5/hr if you use your own car.

Let me know if you're interested
<3 Berko

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  2 01:11:55 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Wed, 2 Oct 2013 01:11:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] League of Legends - World Finals Viewing Party!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201D903C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello everyone!

This is a formalish announcement of the viewing party for the League of Legends Season 3 World Championships!

SK Telcom T1, a team from Korea, will face off against Royal Club from China in an epic clash for one million dollars and the Summoners Cup, starting at 11 PM EST in AC126. If you're a fan of League of Legends, or just eSports in general, you won't want to miss this!

We'll be handing out tons of swag at the event, including some limited edition stuff that you haven't seen before (even we don't know what it is!) And of course, you'll be able to celebrate LoL with good company and meet other Summoners at Olin.

Interested in League of Legends but haven't played much? We'll have a couple of expert players in the audience as well to walk you through the action.

If you're gonna show up, please add yourself to the event on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/622043394483559/ so I can keep track of who is coming (this effects how much swag we get :D)

Yours,

-William

P.S. We're handing out those Rammus hats at this event as well :3

From amankapur91 at gmail.com  Wed Oct  2 10:59:04 2013
From: amankapur91 at gmail.com (Aman Kapur)
Date: Wed, 2 Oct 2013 10:59:04 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] E: majors, auto fill form now!!!!
Message-ID: <CAKKfHYevHkA+WhHO80d3fKZcLqvQamNknSycg4AhAFS0-LD7-A@mail.gmail.com>

--047d7bacbb5c7ab14a04e7c34f4f
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hello potential or exists E with majors,

Margaret Ann Seger '13, Reyner Crosby '13, and myself built a tiny app for
you all to save you the trouble of filling that wierd E with concentration
form. It will auto fill the form based on the courses you have already
taken and which major you select.

You can save the form once its done. Email a link to your advisor to share
it and edit it later on in life as well.


http://declare-it.olinapps.com/

Let me know if there are bugs you find.

#LateBuildDay project

Comments/suggestions/feedback/ideas/hatemail always welcome.

-- 

Aman Kapur

--047d7bacbb5c7ab14a04e7c34f4f

From Victoria.Coleman at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  2 17:26:34 2013
From: Victoria.Coleman at students.olin.edu (Victoria Coleman)
Date: Wed, 2 Oct 2013 17:26:34 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Want a plant friend?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013020297A8C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Is your windowsill lonely? Do you want a small green sprout of happiness? Well, I have a few (9ish) baby plants I raised, and I need loving homes for them. I don't know the name, but they are a slightly strange, succulent plant that sprouts babies from all along the edges of its leaves. Ping me if interested. 100% guarentee of happiness*

-Victoria

*1/1 users agree: "adorable leafy things that look like they comes from cartoons. When ModCon or SCOPE or something gets you down, you will always have a friend" -Amanda

From: grow-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:grow-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On B=

From: David Pudlo
Sent: Monday, September 30, 2013 1:42 PM
To: grow at lists.olin.edu<mailto:grow at lists.olin.edu>; carpediem at lists.olin.e=
du<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [GrOW] New Weekly Meeting!

Tl;dr: We're meeting Wednesdays 5-6 in EH1 to work on initiatives. No more =
Friday meetings.

Ntl;r:                      We're changing the plan for the weekly meetings=
!
                First of all, meetings will now be Wednesdays 6:30-7:30 in =
EH1. We wanted to make the meeting time and place more convenient, and in a=
 more conversational space than a classroom. There will be no more Friday m=
eetings (cancel that iCal of yours!).

                Second of all, meetings will now be focused more on getting=
 things done instead of discussion based. We'll actually be working on init=
iatives to make Olin and the world a better place. This Wednesday we're goi=
ng to split up into three groups:


*        Dining Hall Initiatives: let's reduce the impact of the food we ea=
t at Olin.

*        Solar Initiatives: Let's get significant solar energy here at Olin=
.

*        Gardening Initiatives: Let's work on growing things here at Olin.

Each of these initiatives have efforts started and work that needs to be do=
ne. These are projects that hit at real issues that we can have a real impa=
ct with. We are going to actively make the world a better place, and we wan=
t you to help us.

Send me an email if you have any questions/are curious about an initiative.
-David

From James.Nee at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  2 21:28:18 2013
From: James.Nee at students.olin.edu (James Nee)
Date: Wed, 2 Oct 2013 21:28:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Advanced Welding Training
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401302143FE3A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401302143FE3AEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ethan's Advanced Welding co-curricular didn't make the co-curricular deadli=
ne this semester, but that isn't stopping him from running...

Advanced Welding Non-curricular!

Unlike a co-curricular, this non-curricular will not go on your transcript!
But it will expose you to a bunch of wild and crazy welding and cutting pro=
cesses, such as:
- Plasma arc cutting (PAC)
- Oxy-fuel cutting (OFC)
- Oxy-acetylene welding (OFW)
- Pulse TIG (GTAW-P)
- Torch brazing (TB)
- Stick welding (SMAW)

The only requirements are:
- You must already have completed Olin weld training, including having pass=
ed the 3/16" mild steel guided bend test
- You must apply!

To apply, email elabowitz at gmail.com<mailto:elabowitz at gmail.com> with the su=
bject "Welding Non-Curricular Application" and a paragraph explaining why y=
ou want to participate in this non-curricular.


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401302143FE3AEXVS01oline_

Subject: [Carpediem] On October 3rd, he asked me what day it was.
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440011@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440011EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It's October 3rd aka National Mean Girls Day!
We will be screening the movie in the projection room above the auditorium =
WH 402 at 9:00 pm. All are welcome!

For those of you who have never seen it, it was written and directed by Tin=
a Fey and stars Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McCadams, and Amanda Seyfried. It is =
an absolutely hilarious classic.

<3 Nicole and Sophia

From Mark.Muraoka at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  3 11:10:41 2013
From: Mark.Muraoka at students.olin.edu (Mark Muraoka)
Date: Thu, 3 Oct 2013 11:10:41 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free 1 year CATIA Student until 10/15
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130214400B1@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130214400B1EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,

For those interested, Dassault Systems is allowing students to get a free v=
ersion of CATIA V5-62013  until 10/15/13. CATIA is basically SolidWorks on =
crack, the SolidWorks you wish your SolidWorks was, and is the software of =
choice for most of the major auto and aerospace companies and their supplie=
rs. A license generally runs $15k/seat. See below for info.

http://academy.3ds.com/software/catia/catia-v5-student-edition/

For the valid proof of academic enrollment, the StAR Center can get you doc=
uments that will be approved (they approved myself and another member of my=
 SCOPE team).

Thanks!

Mark Muraoka
Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering
Mechanical Engineering 2014
My Portfolio<http://markmuraoka.com/portfolio/>
M: (808) 203-9237

From Elliott.Donlon at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  3 11:52:01 2013
From: Elliott.Donlon at students.olin.edu (Elliott Donlon)
Date: Thu, 3 Oct 2013 11:52:01 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FIRST GLASS CLUB MEETING OMG
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440111@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440111EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello everyone,

I am pleased to announce that although we still have a serious lack of supp=
lies, the first two glass club meetings ever will commence at 8:00pm, Monda=
y Oct 7th (that is next Monday) and 9:10pm, Tuesday Oct 8th. At these times=
, we will be meeting in AC 413 (the materials science lab). The purpose of =
these meetings is to get members of the club familiar with exactly what we =
will be doing, do safety training, and hopefully to get everyone's hands on=
 a torch. You only need to make it to one of these, we just want to make su=
re everyone can make it to one. If you can't make either of those, let me k=
now and I will reschedule/schedule an additional meeting/train you myself/d=
o something to make it work.

For those who are really excited, check out these videos of people making t=
hings:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3D8zlEq41ckAs
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DhxkioRmu89I


That is all.
-Elliott

P.S. Bring sunglasses if you have them.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440111EXVS01oline_

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  3 14:52:16 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Thu, 3 Oct 2013 14:52:16 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] League of Legends - World Finals Viewing Party NEW
	INFORMATION
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201D9043@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Everyone!

Tomorrow, in AC126 at 11 PM, We'll be watching League of Legends World Finals! That's awesome!

However, I have even more awesome news to report

We have obtained some special prizes to be raffled off between games, including a Logitech G710+ Mechanical Gaming Keyboard (retails for 119 USD) and a Platronics Commander Gamecom Headset (A limited edition item that retails for over 250 dollars!)

You have to be present in between games in order to win, and we need folks to show up and register on the Facebook page that you're going to come! So please, if you have even a small interest in League of Legends, come watch with us and potentially walk away with some sweet, sweet loot.

The facebook page for the event is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/622043394483559/ so please register your intent to come so we can prepare for you! (and buy foodstuffs!)

The event is FREE to attend!

See you tomorrow at 11PM in AC126!


-William

From Geetanjali.Gubba at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct  3 16:32:49 2013
From: Geetanjali.Gubba at students.olin.edu (Geetanjali Gubba)
Date: Thu, 3 Oct 2013 16:32:49 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Be Interviewed for an Increase Olin's Awareness Project
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440292@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440292EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Olin students!

As a part of a project to increase Olin's awareness outside of the bubble, =
Rachel and I would like to interview students from all grade levels (first =
years through super-seniors) on what the joy of engineering and innovation =
mean to them. We will hold a lunch group-interview session/brainstorm tomor=
row from 12:30 - 1:30 pm. To convey our appreciation, we will be ordering s=
ushi for lunch from Gari, vegetarian and non-vegetarian.

We would like a female and male student from each year (2013 - 2017). If yo=
u are interested, please email me your name, class year, and food restricti=
ons/allergies. We will get back with you all asap if you are selected.

Looking forward to interacting with you!

Best,

Geeta Gubba
Mechanical Engineering
Olin College of Engineering, 2013
geeta at students.olin.edu<mailto:geeta at students.olin.edu>


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440292EXVS01oline_

Hi Mtg players and Carpe!

The Magic the Gathering club will be holding its first event of the year ne=
xt Saturday, Oct 12th at 2:00pm! This event will take the form of a draft t=
ournament where you make your decks on the spot. On top of that, we will be=
 drafting a crazy joke set called Unhinged<http://www.wizards.com/magic/tcg=
/productarticle.aspx?x=3Dmtg/tcg/unhinged/productinfo>. This set is crazy f=
un and since they are unplayable normally, we will be re-drafting the cards=
 we have so it will be FREE.
We only have 11 slots because of the number of cards we have, so be sure to=
 sign up on the wiki: http://mrwiki.olin.edu/mrwiki/MagicDraft
Hope to see you there.

That is all.
-Elliott

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440342@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Solidworks not working? Linearity driving you crazy? Program compiling? SCO=
PE blues? Roommate hug parties just a no?
Then come de-stress at Olimprov (your everyday short form improv) this FRID=
AY at 10PM in the Auditorium!

Do improv. Watch improv.* Be improvalicious.

This will also double as a "mime workshop/how-to". (*gasp* Mimes?! D: ) Whi=
ch is super awesome and even more hilarious if you have an assistant. So yo=
u will definitely want to bring a buddy for this one. ;D

Also, I still have ice cream! You should help me eat it. I don't mind doing=
 it myself, but I'm kind of allergic and enjoy being conscious on weekends.=
 Plus it is delicious. Bring your own cups and spoons. (Physical will be mo=
re useful)

*Audience-only members are welcome.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013021440342EXVS01oline_

u>; 'gcsp at lists.olin.edu'

WH 402 at 9:00 pm. All are welcome!

a Fey and stars Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McCadams, and Amanda Seyfried. It is =
an absolutely hilarious classic.

r you like.

Subject: [Carpediem] Be Interviewed for an Increase Olin's Awareness Projec=
t

Hello Olin students!

As a part of a project to increase Olin's awareness outside of the bubble, =
Rachel and I would like to interview students from all grade levels (first =
years through super-seniors) on what the joy of engineering and innovation =
mean to them. We will hold a lunch group-interview session/brainstorm tomor=
row from 12:30 - 1:30 pm. To convey our appreciation, we will be ordering s=
ushi for lunch from Gari, vegetarian and non-vegetarian.

We would like a female and male student from each year (2013 - 2017). If yo=
u are interested, please email me your name, class year, and food restricti=
ons/allergies. We will get back with you all asap if you are selected.

Looking forward to interacting with you!

Best,

Geeta Gubba
Mechanical Engineering
Olin College of Engineering, 2013
geeta at students.olin.edu<mailto:geeta at students.olin.edu>

Subject: [Carpediem] Buy my Rockapella ticket!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401302144093F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey all,

About a month ago I carpe'd a Rockapella<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dc=
uzc4jgwlT8> concert in Boston for this Saturday. Unfortunately, something c=
ame up for me, and I'm no longer available to go this weekend. If you're in=
terested in seeing one of the best a cappella groups in the world<http://ww=
w.youtube.com/watch?v=3D1tReTJGOOnQ> tomorrow night, message the heck out o=
f me. The group is planning to leave at ~6:30 PM, and it'll be a dang good =
show<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DKd_IWQ1Hzyw>. I paid $35 for the tick=
et originally, but I can be negotiated with.

Love,
Greg

Hey ya!
What's cooler than being cool? OWSAC! That's right, a new club I started de=
dicated to winter sports, activities, and hot chocolate. During the warmer =
months, we'll be making regular trips to the babson ice center to skate and=
 maybe even play some hockey (paid for by the club of course). During the f=
un part of the year, we'll be doing all sorts of awesome stuff. Snow fort b=
uilding, snowball fights, skiing and snowboarding, and snowshoeing are just=
 a couple of the awesome activities we might be doing. So sign up at https:=
//lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/owsac.

It'll pretty much be like this: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DEV5CC25fcY=
M


Griffin Crooke Tschurwald
262-366-4594
Olin College of Engineering

From Celeste.Maisel at students.olin.edu  Sat Oct  5 16:27:53 2013
From: Celeste.Maisel at students.olin.edu (Celeste D. Maisel)
Date: Sat, 5 Oct 2013 16:27:53 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Last Will and Testament
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130202A7607@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Today is my birthday and being one year closer to the grave has made me contemplate my purpose on this earth.  I know I am not long for this world since I am graduating at the end of this semester and I will have no need for many material possessions where I am going afterwards.  Therefore, I have put together a living document I will be updating throughout the semester with items I am looking to sell or give away.  Some things are free, others I have listed a price, but feel free to make me an offer on anything, I'm open to price negotiations.
If you want something, write your name in the "Name" column to reserve it!
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AmbsvLlHI8chdDhmY05td0s1RTE0cDJEQnBYY2YwZmc&usp=drive_web#gid=0

Hi everyone,

Sorry for the late notice, but there is a weekly Bhagavad Gita (Indian Phil=
osophy) study group starting tomorrow at Wellesley. Please email me back if=
 you are interested in coming! We will be leaving from EH1 at 12 pm sharp t=
omorrow. It's very introspective and reflective, and great if you are into =
practical philosophy!

See email below for more details. Hope to see some new faces this year, esp=
ecially first and second years!!

Best,

Geeta

From: indianclub-bounces at lists.olin.edu<mailto:indianclub-bounces at lists.oli=
n.edu> [mailto:indianclub-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Shivam Desai
Sent: Friday, October 04, 2013 3:53 PM
To: indianclub at lists.olin.edu<mailto:indianclub at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [IndianClub] Bhagavad Gita Study

All,

Every Sunday (starting this Sunday, October 6th) from 12:15pm to 1:30pm the=
re will be a Bhagavad Gita Study session at Wellesley led by our Tri-Colleg=
e Hindu Chaplain, Vaishali Chandrashekar. Geeta and I went to this all of l=
ast year and it's pretty fun. We get a chance to hang out with members from=
 Wellesley's WASAC and Babson's AMAN. Each session, after we finish eating =
and mingling, we read a passage and spend time discussing the meaning behin=
d it.

Email me back if you want to come, and you do NOT have to be religious in o=
rder to attend.

We'd love to have more people attend!
Shivam

rgia","serif"'>Email me back if you want to come, and you do NOT have to be=

Love math? Interested in teaching 5th grade kids the fun parts of math with=
 me and the fabulous midnight mathematician Kevin O'Toole?
We'll be running a math club from 8-8:45am every Friday morning at Newman E=
lementary School (starting soon!).
I will be driving, so you have a ride, and we'll be back for 9am classes.
Come teach math with us! Whether you want to do it once or twice, or as a r=
egular thing, let us know if you're interested!

~Molly and Kevin

Call for November Frankly Speaking articles!
Every member of the Olin community is welcome to write for Frankly Speaking=
.
Reply to this email with proposals for articles.
Column questions- Need advice? Submit to the Gentleman and the Dominatrix a=
t fscolumn at gmail.com<mailto:fscolumn at gmail.com> for a thoughtful and knowle=
dgeable answer.


Faculty Interviewer - Love to learn new things about your professors and Ol=
in administrators? Become Frankly Speaking's new faculty interviewer. Reply=
 to this email for more information.
Submission deadlines:
Sunday 9/6 optional drop-in meeting to discuss article ideas (7pm, WH2 anti=
-lounge)
Thursday 9/10 Articles ideas due
Sunday 9/13 First drafts due
Friday 9/20 Second drafts due
Wednesday 9/23 Final drafts due (drop-dead deadline)
Find us online<http://franklyspeakingnews.com/>!
Join the distribution list<https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/franklys=
peakingdistribution>! (1 email/month, with the pdf of the issue attached)
______________
Lyra Silverwolf
Editor-in-Chief

In-Reply-To: <6804CE9E-79BF-4211-A564-93C09B2E4253@students.olin.edu>

i-lounge)

Sunday 10/13 First drafts due
Friday 10/20 Second drafts due
Wednesday 10/23 Final drafts due (drop-dead deadline)

edu<mailto:Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Call for November Frankly Speaking articles!

.
Reply to this email with proposals for articles.
Column questions- Need advice? Submit to the Gentleman and the Dominatrix a=
t fscolumn at gmail.com<mailto:fscolumn at gmail.com> for a thoughtful and knowle=
dgeable answer.

in administrators? Become Frankly Speaking's new faculty interviewer. Reply=
 to this email for more information.
Submission deadlines:

-lounge)

Sunday 9/13 First drafts due
Friday 9/20 Second drafts due
Wednesday 9/23 Final drafts due (drop-dead deadline)

peakingdistribution>! (1 email/month, with the pdf of the issue attached)

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Sun Oct  6 20:22:59 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Sun, 6 Oct 2013 20:22:59 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Olin Pirate Radio: Live. Uncensored. Olin.
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201D905F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello everyone.

I come today to bring you a new endeavor of mine that I think will have interesting results. I present to you...

Olin Pirate Radio.

What is OPR? OPR is designed to be an alternative to pandora, to spotify, and to other music applications, in that it is an online radio station that plays music for the Olin community.

What makes this different is a few things:

1. Anyone can broadcast any song they want at any time.

2. Anyone can hold a show on OPR.

3. Anyone can submit a song or piece they want played on air, and it will be added.

Right now, all of the music that I have is random albums that I have sitting on my hard drive this very moment. The list is randomly generated and, quite honestly, is not the greatest in the world. However, you can help change that.

If you want to listen into OPR, click here and click the Listen Now link at the top of the page: http://66.172.11.252:8000/index.html?sid=1

If you want to submit a song to be added to the rotation, click here: http://form.jotform.us/form/32787220713150

If you want to broadcast to OPR, please send me a message and I can get you set up. The gist of it is you will need Winamp and the Shoutcast DSP plugin, and the password to the server is olinpirateradio.

If you want to help out building OPR, please send me a message too. I'm working on building out a website, an easier listening player, better playlist generation, and much much more.

If you want to host a show or anything of that sort, please give me a ping too.

If you have any comments, concerns, questions, desires, blind rage, or questionable intent, also feel free to send me a message.

Yours,

-William

	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapedefaults v:ext=3D"edit" spidmax=3D"1026" />
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

<o:idmap v:ext=3D"edit" data=3D"1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=3DEN-US link=3Dblue vli=
nk=3Dpurple><div class=3DWordSection1><p class=3DMsoNormal><img width=3D583=

> It=92s for shits and giggles +/- science. =85so this isn=92t part of a st=
udy or
> anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
> replies, most consistent repliers, etc.****
>
>  ****
>
> *=85but seriously, why are you up that late?*****
>
> Usually it=92s MADVLSI. The course=92s workload operates on a 1/14th duty
> cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.****
>
>  ****
>
> *Do you sleep?*****
>
> Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
> multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.****
>
>  ****
>
> *What=92s the least you=92ve slept in a week?*****
>
> I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
> includes an all-nighter. There=92s probably a correlation to sleep in the=
re
> somewhere.****
>
>  ****
>
> *Am I failing ModCon?*****
>
> No comment.****
>
>  ****
>
> Thanks!****
>
> ~e****
>
>  ****

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=

Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=
s.olin.edu>>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

/* Style Definitions */
p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.hoenzb
	{mso-style-name:hoenzb;}
span.EmailStyle20
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
span.EmailStyle21
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
span.EmailStyle22
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct  7 16:46:41 2013
From: Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu (Molly L. Farison)
Date: Mon, 7 Oct 2013 16:46:41 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Imagine you were in POE... then let your
 imagination	run wild
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201FE7E4@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201FE7E4@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130215E51CB@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130215E51CBEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I just visited Spaulding rehabilitation hospital today, and the people ther=
e had an idea that would make a great POE project and also make a real diff=
erence in people's lives: an automated adapted rowing machine for people wi=
th spinal cord injuries.

People with spinal cord injuries have a really tough time exercising. Rowin=
g with a rowing machine is one of the few options they have that requires m=
inimal adaptation. They get strapped into the machine, use their arms to pu=
ll back on the bar, then come back forward to do it again. At Spaulding, th=
ey use electrodes to activate your quad muscles when you're pulling back an=
d activate your hamstring muscles to come forward. Right now, an assistant =
manually presses a button to switch between these electrode states. They'd =
like some sort of sensor integration into the rowing machine so that you co=
uld tell when the person has gone all the way back and automatically switch=
 on the hamstring electrodes so they come back forward. An emergency stop b=
utton (perhaps activated by leaning your head way back) would also be a mus=
t. Independence is huge for people who use wheelchairs, and a person I talk=
ed to today said he'd love to be able to row by himself, but he can't use h=
is thumbs to press the button. I have his contact info, and I think this wo=
uld make a super-interesting, well-scoped POE project (with some cool unive=
rsal design in it too). The rowing machines are already available - all you=
'd need to do is make a system to turn electrodes on and off based on senso=
r inputs.

~Molly

Hi guys,

Just in case you missed it the first time, we're having a Magic the Gatheri=
ng draft tournament this Saturday at 2pm. We will be drafting UNHINGED so t=
here will be lots of laughs and will be more chill than our normal tourname=
nts. Don't worry about not having a deck, the nature of the set is such tha=
t we'll just be building them on the spot anyway.
Sign up here: http://mrwiki.olin.edu/mrwiki/MagicDraft

-Elliott

Subject: [Carpediem] Imagine you were in POE... then let your
 imagination	run wild
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130215E51CB@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130201FE7E4@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130215E53B2EXVS01oline_

This is a ridiculously cool project, on so many levels! You have all sorts =
of awesome design aspects in a real world, perfectly scoped project for peo=
ple who are usually amazing to work with. In other words, doitdoitdoit!

My two cents.

Matt

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Molly L. Farison
Sent: Monday, October 07, 2013 4:47 PM
To: Amanda Sutherland; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Imagine you were in POE... then let your imaginati=
on run wild

I just visited Spaulding rehabilitation hospital today, and the people ther=
e had an idea that would make a great POE project and also make a real diff=
erence in people's lives: an automated adapted rowing machine for people wi=
th spinal cord injuries.

People with spinal cord injuries have a really tough time exercising. Rowin=
g with a rowing machine is one of the few options they have that requires m=
inimal adaptation. They get strapped into the machine, use their arms to pu=
ll back on the bar, then come back forward to do it again. At Spaulding, th=
ey use electrodes to activate your quad muscles when you're pulling back an=
d activate your hamstring muscles to come forward. Right now, an assistant =
manually presses a button to switch between these electrode states. They'd =
like some sort of sensor integration into the rowing machine so that you co=
uld tell when the person has gone all the way back and automatically switch=
 on the hamstring electrodes so they come back forward. An emergency stop b=
utton (perhaps activated by leaning your head way back) would also be a mus=
t. Independence is huge for people who use wheelchairs, and a person I talk=
ed to today said he'd love to be able to row by himself, but he can't use h=
is thumbs to press the button. I have his contact info, and I think this wo=
uld make a super-interesting, well-scoped POE project (with some cool unive=
rsal design in it too). The rowing machines are already available - all you=
'd need to do is make a system to turn electrodes on and off based on senso=
r inputs.

~Molly

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.=
edu> [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Amanda Sutherla=

e built? What crazy ideas do you have?

Share your imagination
~ Amanda

div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

nk=3Dpurple><div class=3DWordSection1><p class=3DMsoNormal>There will be bl=
ues music. And a me, that you can dance with.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoN=
ormal>And a nick Ostrom and a fabulous morgan for a little bit of time.<o:p=

Hi all,

Athenahealth will be having an info session on Tuesday 10/8 from 7-8 PM in
AC126.
Come learn about our company and what it's like to work there! :)

Pizza and drinks will be provided.

athenahealth info session
Come learn about what is like to work at athenahealth, what kind of jobs we
have available, and how you can apply! There will be Olin alums to answer
any questions you may have about working for athenahealth, plus a great
presentation about our company's mission and culture. And there's tons of
free pizza!
*When*
Tue, October 8, 7pm =96 8pm GMT-04:00
*Where*
AC 126
*Who*
=95
Jing Li
=95
carpediem at lists.olin.edu

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=

Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=

Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It?s for shits and giggles +/- science. ?so this isn?t part of a study or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

?but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it?s MADVLSI. The course?s workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What?s the least you?ve slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that includes an all-nighter. There?s probably a correlation to sleep in there somewhere.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there somewhere.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

> To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
> Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?
> 
> Hello again, Carpe. It?s been far too long, hasn?t it?
> 
> Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:
> 
> WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
> It?s for shits and giggles +/- science. ?so this isn?t part of a study or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.
> 
> ?but seriously, why are you up that late?
> Usually it?s MADVLSI. The course?s workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.
> 
> Do you sleep?
> Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.
> 
> What?s the least you?ve slept in a week?
> I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that includes an all-nighter. There?s probably a correlation to sleep in there somewhere.
> 
> Am I failing ModCon?
> No comment.
> 
> Thanks!
> ~e
>

> Sent: Monday, October 22, 2012 3:38 AM

>

> Usually it?s MADVLSI. The course?s workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.
>

> Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.
>

>> 
>> Hello again, Carpe. It?s been far too long, hasn?t it?
>> 
>> Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:
>> 
>> WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
>> It?s for shits and giggles +/- science. ?so this isn?t part of a study or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.
>> 
>> ?but seriously, why are you up that late?
>> Usually it?s MADVLSI. The course?s workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.
>> 
>> Do you sleep?
>> Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.
>> 
>> What?s the least you?ve slept in a week?
>> I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that includes an all-nighter. There?s probably a correlation to sleep in there somewhere.
>> 
>> Am I failing ModCon?
>> No comment.
>> 
>> Thanks!
>> ~e

Hey guys,
Here's an interesting opportunity you could do over the summer.

-Jasper

From: Andy Chen <achen at kpcb.com<mailto:achen at kpcb.com>>
Date: Thursday, October 3, 2013 12:30 PM
To: Alyson Goodrow <alyson.goodrow at olin.edu<mailto:alyson.goodrow at olin.edu>=
>
Subject: Applications Open! KPCB Engineering & Product Fellows Program

Alyson

Thank you again for being such a great university partner for the KPCB Fell=
ows Program!  We're honored and very excited to be working with you again i=
n announcing our program, and we look forward to hosting students from Olin=
 at our portfolio companies for both the engineering AND a new year-long Pr=
oduct Fellows Program.

Detailed information about the KPCB Fellows Program can be found at:

http://www.kpcbfellows.com/

You can also retweet our announcement at http://www.twitter.com/kpcbfellows=
 or "like" our page at http://www.facebook.com/kpcbfellows

This e-mail contains a sample e-mail with program information that we hope =
you'll use to promote the Engineering and Product Fellows Program to your s=
tudents. The Engineering Program is tailored towards CS and EE students, an=
d the Product Program is tailored towards students with a joint business/de=
sign and engineering background. Please feel free to customize the message =
appropriately and don't hesitate to let me know if you require anything els=
e. Thank you again!

Best,
Andy



E-mail for KPCB Fellows Program

Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers (www.kpcb.com<http://www.kpcb.com>), a wor=
ld-leading venture capital firm located in Silicon Valley, just announced t=
hat they are now accepting applications for the 2014 KPCB Engineering and P=
roduct Fellows Program and we'd like to share this opportunity with you.

Website: http://www.kpcbfellows.com/

The KPCB Fellows Program offers top U.S. college and graduate students a ch=
ance to work inside innovative Silicon Valley startups. The three-month sum=
mer program is focused on engineering. A new year-long program is focused o=
n product management.

The goal of the Fellows Program is for students to gain significant experie=
nce working on some of the most unique and challenging engineering and prod=
uct problems, and to develop new relationships that are meaningful to their=
 careers.

Over the course of a summer, KPCB Engineering Fellows will be employed at a=
 KPCB portfolio company, where they can develop their technical skills and =
be mentored by an executive within the company. Participants in the new Pro=
duct Fellows Program will get the chance to spend a full year working at a =
Valley startup.

Fellows will also be invited to attend both private events held by KPCB and=
 others hosted by portfolio companies, where they can meet other talented e=
ngineering and design students, network with luminaries in their respective=
 fields, and explore the San Francisco Bay Area.

To ensure that Fellows have the best possible experience during the summer,=
 the program will accept only a limited number of top applicants.

The application period for the summer 2014 KPCB Engineering Fellows Program=
 and year long Product Fellows Program opened on October 3, 2013. The deadl=
ine for submissions is 11:59 pm PDT on October 31, 2013.

Website: http://www.kpcbfellows.com/

You can also find out more at http://www.twitter.com/kpcbfellows or their F=
acebook page at http://www.facebook.com/kpcbfellows

Links to recent news articles:

Techcrunch

 *   http://techcrunch.com/2013/10/03/kleiner-perkins-adds-year-long-produc=
t-manager-track-to-design-and-engineering-fellows-program/
Fast Company

 *   http://www.fastcompany.com/3019060/fast-feed/kleiner-perkins-launches-=
fellows-program-to-attract-young-product-managers
The Next Web

 *   http://thenextweb.com/insider/2013/10/03/kleiner-perkins-unveils-new-p=
roduct-focused-fellowship-and-announces-2014-program-application-dates/


___________________________

Andy Chen
Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers

<p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";colo=

n style=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span st=

ns-serif";color:black'>&nbsp;</span><span style=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p>=
</span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'font-size:11.5pt;font-family=
:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:black'>The KPCB Fellows Program offers top U.=
S. college and graduate students a chance to work inside innovative Silicon=
 Valley startups. The three-month summer program is focused on engineering.=
 A new year-long program is focused on product management.</span><span styl=
e=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D=
'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:black'>&nbsp;</span><span style=
=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'=
font-size:11.5pt;font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:black'>The goal o=
f the Fellows Program is for students to gain significant experience workin=
g on some of the most unique and challenging engineering and product proble=
ms, and to develop new relationships that are meaningful to their careers.<=
/span><span style=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNorma=
l><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:black'><br></span=
><span style=3D'font-size:11.5pt;font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:b=
lack'>Over the course of a summer, KPCB Engineering Fellows will be employe=
d at a KPCB portfolio company, where they can develop their technical skill=
s and be mentored by an executive within the company. Participants in the n=
ew Product Fellows Program will get the chance to spend a full year working=
 at a Valley startup.</span><span style=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span><=
/p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";c=

","sans-serif";color:black'>Fellows will also be invited to attend both pri=
vate events held by KPCB and others hosted by portfolio companies, where th=
ey can meet other talented engineering and design students, network with lu=
minaries in their respective fields, and explore the San Francisco Bay Area=
.</span><span style=3D'color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNor=
mal><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:black'>&nbsp;</=

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Hello all!



Taboo is pleased to host our first event of the year: Taboo Thursday (forme=
rly Taboo Tuesday and "The Sex"). For those of you who don't know or who ha=
ve forgotten Taboo Thursday is an event centered around awful, terrible rom=
ance novels. We get together to read them aloud, laugh at how bad they are,=
 and indulge in deserts and snacks.



9:30 on Thursday, October 10th, in Suite 206.



Everybody is welcome! We hope to see you there!

The Sex-E Board


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401302175ACE7EXVS01oline_

From Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct  9 09:28:03 2013
From: Molly.Farison at students.olin.edu (Molly L. Farison)
Date: Wed, 9 Oct 2013 09:28:03 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Contra at Wellesley!
Message-ID: <37FAC7BB-C282-4CED-A9CF-7B0B3CD1197C@students.olin.edu>

There's a contra dance at Wellesley College in Alumnae Hall on Friday, starting at 7:30! What is contra? It's a fun-filled parter-switching dance where you get to spin around and meet lots of people. No experience necessary! There will be a live band called Perpetual E-motion, which is absolutely amazing.

 I'll be leaving Olin at 7:20 with 3 more spots in my car. Let me know if you want to join! Biking there is also a good option. It costs somewhere between $3-10 (sliding scale) so pay what you can pay. The money goes to the fabulous live band!

~Molly

Sent from my iPhone

Hey all

In the spirit of career fair, I'm forwarding a MechE job positing for the
New England area. It's coming from Stephen Lee, who is recommended as "a
great guy, very laid back and does some pretty cool stuff."

Begin forwarded message:

We are looking for entry level, junior and senior mechanical engineers at
my work (Philips Color Kinetics). I really enjoy working there, it is a
great place. We make architectural LED lighting. Our lights are on the
Zakim Bridge and Custom House in Boston, the Empire State Building, and
lots of other neat places. There are lots of ME challenges in this type of
lighting, believe it or not. A lot of fun and a great place to learn. I
have a great boss, he was at Segway for a number of years. Feel ...

<div dir=3D"ltr">Hey all<div><br></div><div>In the spirit of career fair, I=
&#39;m forwarding a MechE job positing for the New England area. It&#39;s c=
oming from Stephen Lee, who is recommended as &quot;a great guy, very laid =
back and does some pretty cool stuff.&quot;<br>

<br><div class=3D"gmail_quote"><div style=3D"word-wrap:break-word"><div><di=

Codecademy (codecademy.com) is the best place I've ever worked, and they're
giving a tech talk tonight about Codex, the system they use to safely
execute student code. You should come if you're at all interested in
frontend *or* backend software design/development at an awesome
education-related startup.

At the end, you can ask me questions about what it was like to work there
over the summer.

Julian

P.S. There will be food from Chipotle

If you do, come to WH4L with a bowl and a spoon and have some ice cream (French vanilla) and rainbow sprinkles. We have somewhere on the order of 2 gallons. 

If you don't, stop lying to yourself and come anyway.

ice to it&#8230;). <o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p=
><p class=3DMsoNormal>~Amanda <o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>=

From Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct 10 11:27:43 2013
From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Thu, 10 Oct 2013 11:27:43 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Improv Tomorrow! @10pm
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C43CA@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C43CAEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C43CAEXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C43CAEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You can come right on time.
You can come *slightly* late.
You can come for part of it.
So make it a date.

You can come with your enemies.
You can come with your friends
And we can celebrate together
Another joyous week's end.

The theme will be drama
Capes recommended, not required
Be audience or member
Awesomeness can still be acquired.

You can be how you want,
There is not really a DM
So come to Olimprov
Friday, Auditorium, at 10pm

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C43CAEXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct 10 11:31:58 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Thu, 10 Oct 2013 11:31:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Olin Pirate Radio: Connect Information
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2555498@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello everyone.

Olin Pirate Radio is live and available for people to broadcast to. As always, you can tune in at http://66.172.11.252:8000/index.html?sid=1 by clicking the Listen Now link.

I will be creating a more fixed "playlist" later in the day that will incorperate songs that have been submitted by Oliners. If you want to have songs (of any sort), spoken messages, fun jokes, or any audio file included on this playlist, please email me to be added to a shared folder on Dropbox where you can dump whatever you want, or just email me the file. A better system for music submission will be coming soon.

I also have documented the information needed to connect to the server yourself. I ask that you respect other people who are broadcasting and message them before kicking, however, Olin Pirate Radio - Deadweight can and should be kicked at any time so someone may connect, as it is a bot.

The connection information is documented here for now: http://www.olinprojects.com/projects/5256c7221a83a36b781ba99f You will need to log yourself in via the olinapps api, which uses your network credentials.

If you wish to help me build OPR, please send me a message, particularly if you have skills of the graphical variety, if you like having your voice heard on air, or if you're just curious about online radio.

Yours on the airwaves,

-William

Dear Evan,


Your NIDays Boston<http://app.demand.ni.com/e/er?espuid=3DCNATL000010157292=
&s=3D639&lid=3D71517&elq=3D9c03dd138c6d4af38117e6f0620856e6> conference on =
Tuesday, November 5 is quickly approaching and I wanted to personally give =
you some exciting updates on how we have enhanced the event since you regis=
tered. NIDays Boston now features:

 *   Two visionary keynotes
    *   Dean Kamen, FIRST Founder, Inventor, Advocate for Science and Techn=
ology
    *   Mike Santori, Business & Technology Fellow, Product Marketing,view =
invitation video<http://app.demand.ni.com/e/er?espuid=3DCNATL000010157292&s=
=3D639&lid=3D73947&elq=3D9c03dd138c6d4af38117e6f0620856e6>
 *   Research and Academia track with sessions led by leading researchers f=
rom MIT, Penn State, Boston University, and Tufts University
 *   A full-day track dedicated to emerging trends, innovations, and applic=
ations for the aerospace defense and RF industry including fast-paced, 15-m=
inute sessions in the afternoon
 *   Over 40 technical sessions, hands-on workshops, 3,000-square-foot exhi=
bition hall with more than 25 technology and integration partners
 *   All attendees will receive a conference completion certificate and a c=
onference t-shirt. In addition, everyone will be entered into an end of day=
 drawing for test, measurement and control products

Your registration is confirmed and I encourage you to invite your colleague=
s toattend the event<http://app.demand.ni.com/e/er?espuid=3DCNATL0000101572=
92&s=3D639&lid=3D71517&elq=3D9c03dd138c6d4af38117e6f0620856e6>. I look forw=
ard to seeing you in Boston.

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=

Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Hello again, Carpe. It=92s been far too long, hasn=92t it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It=92s for shits and giggles +/- science. =85so this isn=92t part of a stud=
y or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number=
 of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

=85but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it=92s MADVLSI. The course=92s workload operates on a 1/14th duty c=
ycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What=92s the least you=92ve slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There=92s probably a correlation to sleep in there so=
mewhere.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

From Rachel.Sirkin at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 11:14:10 2013
From: Rachel.Sirkin at students.olin.edu (Rachel Sirkin)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 11:14:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Hands on Volunteering
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C49E5@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C49E5EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi!

There is an incredible opportunity to give back to a great local Needham or=
ganization, NAMI. NAMI works with adults with brain challenges like Depress=
ion, PTSD, ADHD, Mental Illness, Addictions, Anxiety, etc.  They work out o=
f a house in Needham which is in need of repairs. They have asked Olin to f=
ind some volunteers to help fix up the house.

I would like to encourage everyone who can to volunteer on Saturday October=
 26th  (it would go from 9:30 on, but the time commitment is very flexible)=
! This is a great way to not only do some good, get off campus, and do hand=
s on work, but also to build a relationship with the community around us!

Please email me back if you are interested in helping out or sign up at the=
 SERV table!

Thanks!
-Rachel


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C49E5EXVS01oline_

From Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 11:36:17 2013
From: Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu (Elizabeth Fitzpatrick)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 11:36:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Dogsitting over Thanksgiving
In-Reply-To: <CE7D8D37.1D97E%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>
References: <CE7D8D37.1D97E%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4A03@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4A03EXVS01oline_

	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4A03EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4A03EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable



From: helpme-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:helpme-bounces at lists.olin.edu] =
On Behalf Of Jessica Townsend
Sent: Friday, October 11, 2013 11:11 AM
To: helpme at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Helpme] Dogsitting over Thanksgiving

Hi Everyone!

Hi Everyone,

I'm looking for a housesitter/dogsitter over the Thanksgiving holiday and t=
hought I would check in with all of you to see if anyone might be intereste=
d. Details are below:

I live in the heart of Union Square in Somerville in a 2- bedroom condo. I'=
d be happy to have more than one person come and stay (there is plenty of r=
oom, and it's probably more fun with a couple of people). Abby is an easy-g=
oing black lab mix. You'd be responsible for feeding her, taking her out a =
few times a day, and just keeping an eye on my place while I'm gone. There'=
s lots to do in Union Square. Harvard, Central, Inman and Porter Squares ar=
e all close, and everything is very bike-able.

If you like dogs, would like an excuse to spend a few nights away from Olin=
, and would like to explore Cambridge and Boston, this could work out well.=
 Even better, I'll pay $30/night. Ideally, I'd like to travel starting the =
Friday night before Thanksgiving, and would get back the Saturday after Tha=
nksgiving (8 nights) but my travel plans are flexible.

Other stuff to know: I have a little patio and grill.  You are welcome to b=
orrow my bike while you are here too. There's lots of good stuff in Union S=
quare, a 5-minute walk away (coffee shops, restaurants, etc). Artisan's Asy=
lum is also a 5 minute walk away. You could cook a big Thanksgiving dinner =
if you wanted.

If you are interested, let me know.

Thanks!

Jessica

Jessica Townsend
Associate Dean for Curriculum and Academic Programs
Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering
Olin College

P.S. Someone told me I could send this to carpe as well as long as I put "D=
ogsitting Opportunity" in the header, so if someone wants to forward it to =
carpe, that would be fine. :)



--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4A03EXVS01oline_

	font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";}

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From Alyson.Goodrow at olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 11:43:04 2013
From: Alyson.Goodrow at olin.edu (Alyson Goodrow)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 11:43:04 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Seminar on the science + technology of digital
 fabrication and it's impact on education @ Cambridge Friends School
Message-ID: <CE7D94C8.11B7B%alyson.goodrow@olin.edu>

--_000_CE7D94C811B7Balysongoodrowolinedu_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

On November 13, 7=968:30 pm the Cambridge Friends School is hosting a semin=
ar series on Constructing Education: Panelists will introduce the science a=
nd technology of digital fabrication, and explore its impact on education.

Panelists: Neil Gershenfeld (MIT), Sherry Lassiter (Teaching Institute for =
Excellence in STEM) and Jan Morrison

Constructing Education.
The digital revolutions in computing and communications are now being follo=
wed by one in fabrication, allowing anyone to make (almost) anything. The i=
ntersection of these advances is challenging underlying assumptions about e=
ducation, including the relationship between formal and informal learning, =
the organization of schools, limitations on resources, and the nature of ac=
creditation. Panelists will introduce the science and technology of digital=
 fabrication, and explore its impact on education.

This seminar is free and open to the public, however seating is limited so =
please register online at www.cfsmass.org<https://www.cfsmass.org/podium/de=
fault.aspx?t=3D36644&rid=3D6648>.

--_000_CE7D94C811B7Balysongoodrowolinedu_
Content-Type: text/html; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 13:26:13 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 13:26:13 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Two Big SSD Sales Today
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A25554A3@EXVS01.olin.edu>

NewEgg is offering a promo on a Toshiba Q Series SSD 256 GB. It's a pretty decent SSD, nothing too fabulous, but the price at 150 bucks is one of the lowest I've seen on the drive.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820168063&nm_mc=EMC-IGNEFL101113&cm_mmc=EMC-IGNEFL101113-_-EMC-101113-Index-_-SSD-_-20168063-L0C

The highest recommended SSD by Oliners, the Samsung 840 Evo 250GB, is also on sale, for 159 bucks on eBay. It's brand new, and this is the lowest price ever on the drive.
http://www.ebay.com/itm/331042641006

Happy deal hunting!

-William

Subject: [Carpediem] Build toys for deaf/blind students
Message-ID: <CAHT-TTDYuHo6vrXMDOuhqBp+JDDs4J2AJxvk4X+RnSA5j+rjtg@mail.gmail.com>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

SHORT: Today. WH2. 3:30-5. Build cool wire toys for deaf and blind students.

LONG:

Hey everyone!

Today we are making toys for deaf and blind children at the Horace Mann
school. Apparently they have a thirteen-year-old boy who is fascinated with
things that move, so we're building galimoto frames! You may have seen them
at the SERV table.

[image: Inline image 1]

Come to WH2 from 3:30-5 to help out! And bring your pliers.

-SERV

--047d7b10cae55e86c404e87a8ad3

Hey everyone!

Today we are making toys for deaf and blind children at the Horace Mann sch=
ool. Apparently they have a thirteen-year-old boy who is fascinated with th=
ings that move, so we're building galimoto frames! You may have seen them a=
t the SERV table and if not, a picture of one is attached.

Come to WH2 from 3:30-5 to help out! And bring your pliers.

-SERV


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4ADFEXVS01oline_
