Admissions would like to use your video - yes, your gloriously awesome vide=
o - to show prospies what Olin is all about.
Lady Gaga flash mobs, pizza zombies, things Oliner's say, you name it. I wi=
ll consider anything on Youtube is already okay to use, but that unfortunat=
ely is not much. :( And most of them are from alumni. Are you going to let =
alumni beat you?

I mean, just look at this! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DH8xJd71wFGc

If you know of Olin made videos on youtube, send me their link. If you have=
 an awesome Olin-themed video, then put it on public so I have access to it=
. Any video and every video you have will be considered (rule though it no =
nudity/partial nudity). Preferably they are all under a minute.

If you feel like making a new video spontaneously over the weekend, let me =
know. I need a general bulk of videos by Sunday night....

Hey Carpe,

Last year, SERV collaborated with the Needham Clergy association to build a=
 meditative labyrinth for Needham's Luminary Stroll. It went really well, a=
nd as a result they're asking us to create a light up display for the Needh=
am Town hall. The scope of what we're doing is a little hazy right now, but=
 I can assure you that it'll be an interesting design challenge. If you're =
interested in doing epic shit and helping town-gown relations, shoot me an =
email.

Best,
Daniel Leong
Olin College of Engineering '16
(208) 301-1477

That's fucking right. Friendly Fire is having a Rollercoaster Tycoon event =
on Monday at 3 PM in EH1. Bring your laptop, your charger, and your childho=
od. (Mouse optional - I found that it's still pleasant without.)

Let it be noted that RCT costs $6 on www.gog.com<http://www.gog.com>. RCT2 =
is $10. Either version comes with both expansion packs, the soundtrack, and=
 no DRM. Be sure to search for "rollercoaster" as one word. For the more un=
scrupulous among you, we're currently looking into whether or not we can sk=
etchily find it for free somewhere.

Let's build some motherfucking roller coasters.

http://i.imgur.com/C5MsN.jpg

From Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 18:07:53 2013
From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 18:07:53 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Reminder: Olimprov Tonight @10pm
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4CF7@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4CF7EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Do you like improv?
If not, then, like, REALLY?
With its humor and games
>From serious to silly.

You can sit to just watch
Or even join in the fun
So give it a chance
All it needs is one.

The theme will be D:Drama
But don't give a fright
Whether a newbie or regular
You'll do alright.

Wear a cape for no reason.
We do have a quorum.
So see you tonight,
10pm, Auditorium.



--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4CF7EXVS01oline_

From Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 11 18:59:58 2013
From: Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu (Logan Davis)
Date: Fri, 11 Oct 2013 18:59:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Tennis Baseball Saturday afternoon
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4D30@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4D30EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey Carpe/OPUS!
I'm trying to gauge interest in a game of Tennis Baseball, sometimes known =
as tennyball, out on the great lawn (or maybe the soccer field if it's open=
) tomorrow afternoon. For those of you who haven't played before, it's base=
ball, but instead of using a baseball and a bat you use tennis equipment, w=
hich makes it way easier to make contact. Also the pitcher stands next to y=
ou and soft-tosses it instead of standing out on a mound, mostly so that sh=
e doesn't get her face tennis balled in.

Anyways, reply directly (NOT reply all) to this email if you're interested.=
 If you have a specific time in the afternoon that you can't make it, let m=
e know so that I can schedule around that. If at least a dozen people say t=
hey're game, we'll do it.

Thanks!
-Logan

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4D30EXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

y easier to make contact. Also the pitcher stands next to you and soft-toss=
es it instead of standing out on a mound, mostly so that she doesn&#8217;t =
get her face tennis balled in. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nb=
sp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Anyways, reply directly (NOT reply all) t=
o this email if you&#8217;re interested. If you have a specific time in the=
 afternoon that you can&#8217;t make it, let me know so that I can schedule=
 around that. If at least a dozen people say they&#8217;re game, we&#8217;l=
l do it. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=
=3DMsoNormal>Thanks!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>-Logan<o:p></o:p></=
p></div></body></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A24C4D30EXVS01oline_--

Subject: [Carpediem] Tennis Baseball at 2:00 PM
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2F46129@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2F46129EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I received sufficient interest, so we're doing this.

WHAT: Tennis baseball. Like baseball, but with tennis gear and a lower risk=
 of taking a ball to the face.
WHEN: 2:00 PM.
WHERE: The Great Lawn. I'll be the guy with the tennis racquet and the glov=
es. If the soccer fields are open, we may move down there.
WHO: You!
WHY: Because there are few things in life more cathartic than whacking a ba=
ll with a stick and watching it fly really far.

See you there!
-Logan

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2F46129EXVS01oline_

Subject: Tennis Baseball at 2:00 PM

WHAT: Tennis baseball. Like baseball, but with tennis gear and a lower risk=
 of taking a ball to the face.
WHEN: 2:00 PM.
WHERE: The Great Lawn. I'll be the guy with the tennis racquet and the glov=

WHO: You!
WHY: Because there are few things in life more cathartic than whacking a ba=
ll with a stick and watching it fly really far.

See you there!

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

 

From: Eric B. Kolker

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It?s been far too long, hasn?t it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It?s for shits and giggles +/- science. ?so this isn?t part of a study or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

?but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it?s MADVLSI. The course?s workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What?s the least you?ve slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that includes an all-nighter. There?s probably a correlation to sleep in there somewhere.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Making a sushi order at 7PM. Any roll costs $7 TOTAL, this includes tax =
and delivery. I'll need that in cash to pay the delivery person, not =
venmo or anything. Pickup from EH1 and I'll send an email when it's =
arriving. Pick from the following:

M1: Cucumber, Avocado or Asparagus Maki

M2: Oshinko Maki
Japanese pickles

M3: Mango Maki
Mango and cucumber

M4: AAC Maki
Asparagus, avocado, cucumber

M5: Triple A Maki
Asparagus, apple, avocado

M6: Tempura Shiitake Mushroom Maki
with unagi sauce

M7: Idaho Maki
Deep fried sweet yam with unagi sauce

M8: Sweet Maki
Inari, cucumber, tamago

M9: Vegetarian Futo Maki
Inari, tamago, cucumber, avocado, Oshinko

M10: Celtics Maki
Avocado, tempura sweet yam, tobiko, yuzu miso sauce and berries

M11: Tekka Maki
Tuna

M12: Sake Maki
Salmon

M13: Negi-Hama Maki
Yellowtail with scallions

M14: Tuna and Avocado Maki

M15: Spicy Tuna Maki / Spicy White Tuna Maki
Tuna or white tuna, tempura flakes, scallion and spicy mayo

M16: Spicy Salmon Maki
Salmon, cucumber, spicy mayo

M17: Mackerel Maki
Pickled Mackerel, cucumber, ginger, jalapeno, and scallion

M18: Alaskan Maki
Salmon and avocado

M19: Philadelphia Maki
Smoked salmon, cucumber, scallions and cream cheese

M20: Spicy Scallop Maki
Scallop, tobiko, cucumber, spicy mayo

M21: Rising Sun Maki
Salmon, cucumber, avocado, tempura flakes, spicy mayo

M22: California Maki
Crab stick, cucumber, avocado and tobiko

M23: Classic California Maki
Real crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and tobiko

M24: Harmony Maki
Baked fish, cucumber, avocado, scallions, sriracha sauce

M25: Tempura White Tuna Maki
with unagi sauce

M26: Unagi Maki
Eel w/ cucumber OR avocado with unagi sauce

M27: Shrimp with Avocado Maki

M28: Baked Salmon and Avocado Maki

M29: Spicy Shrimp and Mango Maki

M30: Crazy Maki
Shrimp tempura, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, and spicy mayo

M31: Shrimp Tempura Maki
Shrimp Tempura, unagi sauce and tobiko

M32: Soft Shell Crab Maki
Soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, unagi sauce and spicy mayo

M33: Salmon Monster Jr. Maki
Baked salmon, crab stick, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, scallions, spicy =
creamy sauce

tcr / 2013.5 / eh1ne

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><i><span =

late?</span></i><o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal =

D'>Usually it&#8217;s MADVLSI. The course&#8217;s workload operates on a =

style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span =

Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

D'>Usually it&#8217;s MADVLSI. The course&#8217;s workload operates on a 1/=
14<sup>th</sup> duty cycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of =
~12 hours.</span><o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-to=
p-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;font=
-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:#1F497D'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></p><=
p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:=
auto'><i><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"=
;color:#1F497D'>Do you sleep?</span></i><o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal=

lly, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multiples =
of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.</span><o:p></o:p></p><p clas=
s=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'>=

Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Hi Everyone,

Glass club will now be meeting regularly on Mondays from 7pm to 9pm and Thu=
rsdays from 9pm to 11pm. We don't yet have all the supplies, so they will b=
e starting this Thursday, not today. Remember to bring your shoes/sunglasse=
s when you come!

-Elliott

P.S. Ashley and I left all the pieces everyone made out on one of the blue =
benches toward the back of the matsci lab. We're working on getting a real =
shelf or box or something to put the finished pieces in that is more perman=
ent. Most of them also cracked for various reasons. Once we get our anneale=
r (probably by next meeting) your beads will crack much less.

This is happening in 45 minutes in EH1, and is going to be totally fucking =
sick. Come relive your childhood and make some sickass ride.

For the unscrupulous, you can find the installer downloads in X:\RCT. If yo=
u install from here, I'm asking you by the honor code to uninstall the game=
s after the event - I hosted the games for the purpose of the event, and am=
 hoping that you don't take the opportunity to steal games.

See you there!
Greg

From: friendlyfire-announce-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:friendlyfire-ann=
ounce-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston

To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu; friendlyfire-announce at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [FriendlyFire-announce] Roller. Coaster. Tycoon.

That's fucking right. Friendly Fire is having a Rollercoaster Tycoon event =
on Monday at 3 PM in EH1. Bring your laptop, your charger, and your childho=
od. (Mouse optional - I found that it's still pleasant without.)

Let it be noted that RCT costs $6 on www.gog.com<http://www.gog.com>. RCT2 =
is $10. Either version comes with both expansion packs, the soundtrack, and=
 no DRM. Be sure to search for "rollercoaster" as one word. For the more un=
scrupulous among you, we're currently looking into whether or not we can sk=
etchily find it for free somewhere.

Let's build some motherfucking roller coasters.

http://i.imgur.com/C5MsN.jpg

tyle=3D'color:#1F497D'>Also there will be </span><span style=3D'font-size:2=
0.0pt;color:#FFC000'>CHEESE</span><span style=3D'color:#1F497D'>, and crack=
ers and fruit and other fancy snackage.<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></body><=
/html>=

Hey dancers,

I've got a pair of all black, canvas, Aris Allen dance sneakers (http://www=
.hepcat.se/images/208-BKBK-womens-all-black-dance-sneaker.jpg) that I'm loo=
king to sell. They are a women's size 7 and have never been used. They're a=

welcome to try them on before paying for them.

They're selling for $50 on the site I got them (http://www.dancestore.com<h=
ttp://www.dancestore.com/>), though they don't appear to sell this color an=
ymore. The price is negotiable.

You can buy them in time to wear them to swing lessons tonight at 8:00!

Thanks,

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It=92s for shits and giggles +/- science. =85so this isn=92t part of a stud=
y or anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number=
 of replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

=85but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it=92s MADVLSI. The course=92s workload operates on a 1/14th duty c=
ycle with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What=92s the least you=92ve slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There=92s probably a correlation to sleep in there so=
mewhere.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=
s.olin.edu>>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem@=
lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

f Horrors!  Coming this Friends and Family Weekend, October 17-19th at 7 pm=
 in Sorenson, we'd love for you to attend!

them at the door, and you can pay by cash, credit, or check!  Forward this =
to all your friends!

Can't wait to see you all there!

Best,

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Headhunters<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dpd_vR3=
aKCxI>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CEC9B1.D4301B80]

Headhunters is about an insecure corporate recruiter who lives a double lif=
e as an art thief. The film is currently the highest grossing Norwegian fil=
m of all time and has Nikolaj Coster-Waldau (Jaime Lannister in HBO's Game =
of Thrones). I promise this film is much more entertaining than last weeks.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, Thuglife
Larissa Little, Mozzarella Sticks
Philicia Chow, Key Grip

f Horrors!  Coming this Friends and Family Weekend, October 17-19th at 7 pm=

to all your friends!

Can't wait to see you all there!

ww.youtube.com/watch?v=3DC4pcg7bXgmU&amp;feature=3Dshare&amp;list=3DPLVfin7=
4Qx3tV-zzYGwPjTnVL-w_yKsrI5</a></div>

                     Xx.           X    X'
                    X 'XX.       .xXx.  X
                    X    'X. xxxX    XxXx.
                    X     'XX        XX' XXXx.
                    Xx      'XXXXXXXX'
                     X

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"I want to give a Late Math Talk on the Four Flat-box Law - the one that sa=
ys you can make any num as a sum of four or less nums, each of whom is a fl=
at-box. (A flat-box, or cube-face, is a num like one, four, nine, and so on=
.) Also, I want to give this talk with no word that is made of more than fo=
ur word-bits (a word-bit is a, or b, or c, and so on.)"
                -Gregory Edelston - 6/19/2013

This Saturday, this is happening. Be there, or be flat-box.

Discretely,
The Midnight Mathematicians

[cid:image003.jpg at 01CECACF.D665CD40]

Date: Thu, 17 Oct 2013 00:32:36 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Knitting Club!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A31FEC5A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A31FEC5AEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi!

Up until the end of my sophomore year, knitting club was a thing. It involv=
ed sporadic events usually centered around watching movies/tv shows while k=
nitting or crocheting. There was a large supply of knitting club materials =
(yarn, needles, etc.) which is probably still around in a closet somewhere.=
  Would anyone be interested if this started up again?

~Liz

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A31FEC5AEXVS01oline_

From Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct 17 09:00:45 2013
From: Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu (Liani Lye)
Date: Thu, 17 Oct 2013 09:00:45 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Ready, Set, HackPrinceton!

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A31FED21EXVS01oline_

Just passing along the message!  If you've any questions, contact Tim Lau a=
t hackprinceton at princetoneclub.com<mailto:hackprinceton at princetoneclub.com>=
.

From: Timothy Lau [mailto:ttlau at princeton.edu]
Sent: Wednesday, October 16, 2013 2:12 AM
To: Liani Lye
Subject: Thank you so much!

Subject: Ready, Set, HackPrinceton!


To our fellow hackers at,


Ever think, "I wish I had the time to build ____, make ____, or create ____=
?" Well now's your time.


Come to HackPrinceton, from November 8th to 10th. It'll be a 48 hour pure i=
njection of fun and a chance to learn something you've wanted to try, work =
on an idea you've always dreamed of, and meet 300+ people from 20+ other sc=
hools.  We'll have speakers, mentors, and plenty of food and energy drinks =
to keep you going!  We're supporting both Software and Hardware tracks for =
hackers, depending on your interest.


No coding experience? Not a problem. We have numerous resources at your dis=
posal, helping you to get involved in the entrepreneurial and tech scene ju=
st like that. We invite all to come and turn the ideas of your dreams into =
reality, win prizes, and have the time of your lives!


We'll be providing travel reimbursements up to $150.  The faster your schoo=
l reaches 50 signups, the faster you'll be put on the short list for a bus =
to HackPrinceton!  For more information and to register, visit hackprinceto=
n.com<http://hackprinceton.com/>!


Looking forward to meeting you all,

Evelyn Ding and Tim Lau

HackPrinceton Organizers


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A31FED21EXVS01oline_

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct 17 14:09:27 2013
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Thu, 17 Oct 2013 14:09:27 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Friendship Dates!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A33BA9E7@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A33BA9E7EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Are you a lonely senior who doesn't know any of the freshmen or sophomores?=
 Are you a freshmen looking to get to know more upperclassmen but don't how=
 to do it in a non-awkward way? Do you just wish you had more friends?

We had this great thing last year! FRIENDSHIP DATES. There are a lot of rea=
lly cool people at Olin that we wish we knew better but don't really run in=
to very often. Guess what? There are other people who feel the same way abo=
ut you! Last year, a lot of people had a lot of fun getting to know people =
that they don't usually connect with, and I think it's a great thing to bri=
ng back.

If you fill out the survey below with your name, I will connect you with tw=
o other random interested individuals for you to set up a dinner/lunch meet=
ing with. Each week, I will send out new assignments for people for you to =
get together and meet!

Let me know if you have any questions/thoughts/ideas.

If you are interested please fill out this form: https://docs.google.com/fo=
rms/d/1Zq8xzzZ3RsZ5C4mlk71Bc9TVQ63sAub0vMScSlfdW9I/viewform

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A33BA9E7EXVS01oline_

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

I'm doing my AHS Capstone Project on environmental philosophy at Olin - par=
ticularly of those who are interested in and/or passionate about the enviro=
nment/sustainability.

I can't complete my AHS Cap without your help, and then I'll never graduate=
 so please take the survey. You might even enjoy it.

Here's the link:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ergg5JJumCpIXSIvwNpY82id=
LBCfaIpNeLhwtxinXzo/viewform

Thanks in advance!
Emily

 Maybe I'll make you cookies or something.

From David.Elkan at students.olin.edu  Sat Oct 19 21:04:22 2013
From: David.Elkan at students.olin.edu (David Elkan)
Date: Sat, 19 Oct 2013 21:04:22 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Beer bottles
Message-ID: <0FFD880B-DFDA-4940-9767-AADA9126072B@students.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe,

TLDR: give me your used beer bottles so I can sanitize them and reuse them for a batch of OBB (Olin Brew Beer).  Bring them to EH4W (no twist-bottles please)

Do you drink beer or other things that come in similar bottles?  Have you been struggling to figure out the most environmentally friendly way to dispose of these bottles?

Well your troubles are over!  Donate your used beer bottles and it'll be reused to hold a beer brewed right here at Olin!

Drop of you non-twist off bottles in 4 west!

Thanks

David

This is just to say that the time left til this is half of one hour. It is =
sure to be a good time.
As we have come to be used to, the bits that you wear should make you look =
fly.

In a way that is not seen or in a way that is cut into tiny bits,
The Late Math Guys

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Kevin O'Toole
Sent: Thursday, October 17, 2013 12:29 AM
To: MidnightMath at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Midnight Math this Saturday: The Four Squares Theorem =
with Greg Edelston

"I want to give a Late Math Talk on the Four Flat-box Law - the one that sa=
ys you can make any num as a sum of four or less nums, each of whom is a fl=
at-box. (A flat-box, or cube-face, is a num like one, four, nine, and so on=
.) Also, I want to give this talk with no word that is made of more than fo=
ur word-bits (a word-bit is a, or b, or c, and so on.)"
                -Gregory Edelston - 6/19/2013

This Saturday, this is happening. Be there, or be flat-box.

Discretely,
The Midnight Mathematicians

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

It has just been said to me that I said a long word. For those of you lost =
in my high-born talk, I "should" tell you that "should" is just one more wa=
y to say "may", and you "should" take it as such.

It "should" also be said that if you do not look as foxy as the rest, it wi=
ll be fine and we will still be glad you came.

From: midnightmath-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:midnightmath-bounces at list=
s.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Kevin O'Toole
Sent: Saturday, October 19, 2013 11:33 PM

Subject: Re: [MidnightMath] [Carpediem] Midnight Math this Saturday: The Fo=
ur Squares Theorem with Greg Edelston

This is just to say that the time left til this is half of one hour. It is =
sure to be a good time.
As we have come to be used to, the bits that you wear should make you look =
fly.

In a way that is not seen or in a way that is cut into tiny bits,
The Late Math Guys

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.=
edu> [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Kevin O'Toole
Sent: Thursday, October 17, 2013 12:29 AM
To: MidnightMath at lists.olin.edu<mailto:MidnightMath at lists.olin.edu>; carped=
iem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] Midnight Math this Saturday: The Four Squares Theorem =
with Greg Edelston

"I want to give a Late Math Talk on the Four Flat-box Law - the one that sa=
ys you can make any num as a sum of four or less nums, each of whom is a fl=
at-box. (A flat-box, or cube-face, is a num like one, four, nine, and so on=
.) Also, I want to give this talk with no word that is made of more than fo=
ur word-bits (a word-bit is a, or b, or c, and so on.)"
                -Gregory Edelston - 6/19/2013

This Saturday, this is happening. Be there, or be flat-box.

Discretely,
The Midnight Mathematicians

7:30 at the Orpheum Theatre tonight in Boston, but she can't go anymore.  S=
he is looking to sell her tickets so someone else can have a ballin time to=
night.  (Just to let you guys know, I will be going tonight with a few othe=
r Oliners, and we are pretty stoked because Franz Ferdinand is AWESOME live=

kets for face value ($30) OBO.  Let me know if you want to go!!!  (Because =
you do.  You really do.)

-Sean

Hey everyone!

The Boston Bhangra Competition is a collegiate competition for Bhangra, a n=
orth Indian folk dance. Here is a video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dv=
0ei_S2S2H0

I went to watch this competition my first-year at Olin, way back when, and =
I absolutely loved it! It even inspired me to do a passionate pursuit in le=
arning Bhangra.

Ticket information is below. We can get discount tickets potentially throug=
h purchasing through Wellesley. Please contact the Wellesley ticket coordin=
ator Ramneek (rnagi at wellesley.edu<mailto:rnagi at wellesley.edu>) directly if =
you are thinking about going!

Best,

Geeta

From: Prerana Nanda [mailto:pnanda at wellesley.edu]
Sent: Sunday, October 20, 2013 1:51 PM
To: Geetanjali Gubba
Subject: Fwd: [WASAC] ***Boston Bhangra Competition!!***



Prerana Nanda
Wellesley College
Class of 2014


Begin forwarded
Subject: [WASAC] ***Boston Bhangra Competition!!***
Mark your calendars -- BOSTON BHANGRA COMPETITION is on SATURDAY, NOVEMBER =
16!!

It's the 10th Anniversary and it's bigger than ever before!

Featuring Bhangra teams from across North America -- Bhangra Empire, Punjab=
i Hit Squad, Nishani Bhangra, Nachdi Jawani Juniors, DC Bhangra Crew, and m=
ore!

Hosted by Jus Reign, with a special performance by Sharmilla

You don't wanna miss out! For questions and tickets (get them now!), contac=
t Ramneek (rnagi at wellesley.edu<mailto:rnagi at wellesley.edu>)
$40 - VIP view
$30 - premium view**
$20 - good view
$10 - food plate
$25 - after party in advance

Orpheum Theater - Boston, MA (less than a 5 minute walk from Park St. Stati=
on!)
Doors open at 5 P.M., competition starts at 6 P.M.

**If at least 20 people purchase the $30 premium view tickets, all premium-=
view ticket holders will receive a $5 discount (i.e. the ticket price will =
be marked down to $25) so tell your friends to come!!

Check out the shout out by Jus Reign: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=
=3Dplayer_embedded&v=3DoD1sSjENZcg

To all people interested in glass-making who aren't on the glass list,

First off, get on the glass list.
Second, I've attached the iCals for glass club's regularly scheduled meetin=
gs:
Monday 7pm-9pm
Thursday 9pm-11pm

Remember to bring sunglasses if you have them!
-Elliott

t into something a bit more interesting than flameworking. We'll have to se=
e.

From larissa.little at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 21 00:51:38 2013
From: larissa.little at students.olin.edu (Larissa Little)
Date: Mon, 21 Oct 2013 00:51:38 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do something - go to Presidents Council!
Message-ID: <CAK_k8jqeHih=PyMNxCGJNFz9_KKhvzcMNVSd=NvT9aKjt=PJ5w@mail.gmail.com>

--001a11c3675e7f12c204e9390cd3
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

President Miller sent out an invitation to students to attend the
Presidents Council meeting this Friday a while ago. This is an opportunity
to be part of a discussion about the future direction of engineering
education with influential and inspiring people. Personally, going to these
has been a defining part of my time at Olin.

The council includes all of Olin's
Trustees<http://www.olin.edu/about_olin/board_trustees.aspx> as
well as CEO's, deans of engineering schools, and other amazing
people<http://www.olin.edu/about_olin/presidents_office/presidents_council.=
aspx>.
And they all love talking to Oliners and think we're awesome.

As a student, you'd either facilitate a breakout session or be a scribe in
a session. The meeting is 8am-12:30pm this Friday, but from what I can
tell, you can just go to the last 1.5h's (the breakout session) if that's
all you're available for. However this is a pretty rare opportunity, so if
you can make it to all of it, I would highly recommend it.

If you're interested, email Carole Perrin <carole.perrin at olin.edu> telling
her why you're interested in a sentence or two, and include info for your
name badge (For example, preferred name, class year, involvements and/or
major, hometown =96 Jimmy Pickleberry =9214, SERV Coordinator, Robitics,
Lynnfield, MA).


Do it! It's super interesting!

-Larissa

--001a11c3675e7f12c204e9390cd3
Content-Type: text/html; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 21 12:36:18 2013
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Mon, 21 Oct 2013 12:36:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [Survey] Survey on Finance
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2555501@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2555501@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A2555504@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Almost 2/3s of respondents do not have a grasp on what their credit score is, which I found to be an interesting datapoint. Expect more finance surveys in the near future about various topics relating to "financial literacy"

Also, if you want to be a part of of the quarter of the student body who has a better grasp on their credit, try a site like https://www.creditkarma.com/. I've used the site for a while and it's great for keeping track of a good estimate on your credit score, for free (it's like mint in it's freeness, no credit card required). No referral magic going on, just a personal recommendation of a tool that I use.

Thanks for responding and look for more interesting questions about finance in the future,

-William

From Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 21 15:14:08 2013
From: Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu (Adam Coppola)
Date: Mon, 21 Oct 2013 15:14:08 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] New Wellesley MWRTA route
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4042@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4042EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,
There's a new bus route in Wellesley opening today. It goes to the Natick m=
all and Woodland station and everywhere in between, and you can use Charlie=
 cards. Here's a link to the info:
http://www.mwrta.com/index.cfm?event=3DSchedules&RouteID=3D30
To be honest, it doesn't look like it will be revolutionarily convenient fo=
r us to do things-they don't have too many routes per day; it takes half an=
 hour to get from Wellesley College to Woodland; fifteen min to get from We=
llesley College to the Natick Mall-but it's probably worth knowing about.
-Adam

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4042EXVS01oline_

Subject: [Carpediem] Robotics mentorship
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4359@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4359EXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey folks, a message from the collaboratory:

The Maimonides School in Brookline is looking for a student to lead a high =
school robotics club.  It would meet once a week from 1:20-2:45, on either =
Tuesday or Thursday. A stipend is available.

If you are interested, please contact:
Barry Ehrlich
Director of Curriculum and Instruction
Maimonides School
34 Philbrick Road
Brookline, MA 02445
617-232-4452, ext. 119
behrlich at maimonides.org<mailto:behrlich at maimonides.org>

Ok all,
Ice skating is for sure NOT GOING TO HAPPEN  on Wednesday night. There's st=
ill a small chance it could happen on Thursday night, but more likely it'll=
 restart next week.

On another note, I think I'm going to go to public skate tomorrow. It's fro=
m 11-12:50. It's free for Oliners, but rentals are $5. However, OWSAC will =
likely be able to reimburse you for your skate rental costs. More word on t=
hat tomorrow morning. Remember, Olin has skates in the ball room you can us=
e. I'm planning on leaving at 11:20 from WH, please reply if you want to co=
me with.


Griffin Crooke Tschurwald

ill a small chance it could happen on Thursday night, but more likely it'll=

On another note, I think I'm going to go to public skate tomorrow. It's fro=
m 11-12:50. It's free for Oliners, but rentals are $5. However, OWSAC will =
likely be able to reimburse you for your skate rental costs. More word on t=
hat tomorrow morning. Remember, Olin has skates in the ball room you can us=
e. I'm planning on leaving at 11:20 from WH, please reply if you want to co=
me with.

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu>
Date: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 3:00 AM
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

 

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

 

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ: 

 

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?

It's for shits and giggles +/- science. .so this isn't part of a study or
anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

 

.but seriously, why are you up that late?

Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle
with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

 

Do you sleep?

Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer
multiples of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

 

What's the least you've slept in a week?

I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that
includes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there
somewhere.

 

Am I failing ModCon?

No comment.

 

Thanks!

~e

From: Eric Kolker <eric.kolker at students.olin.edu<mailto:eric.kolker at student=

lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake?

Hello again, Carpe. It's been far too long, hasn't it?

Let me also take this opportunity to answer the FAQ:

WTFBBQ, Kolker? Why?
It's for shits and giggles +/- science. ...so this isn't part of a study or=
 anything, but if I get bored I may make a few graphs of average number of =
replies, most consistent repliers, etc.

...but seriously, why are you up that late?
Usually it's MADVLSI. The course's workload operates on a 1/14th duty cycle=
 with a two week period and a pulse amplitude of ~12 hours.

Do you sleep?
Usually, but experience shows I can run on consistent, small integer multip=
les of 90-minute REM cycles for a few days on end.

What's the least you've slept in a week?
I think my record latest weekly average bedtime is around 6AM, but that inc=
ludes an all-nighter. There's probably a correlation to sleep in there some=
where.

Am I failing ModCon?
No comment.

Thanks!
~e

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The "who's awake" posts were pretty cute the first time around, but it's ge=
tting a little old for some of us.

Is there a better avenue to vent late night frustrations?
Would making a mailing list be more appropriate?

It's getting to be a bit of a clutter in our inboxes, but I know a some peo=
ple appreciate chains of emails like this.

-Chris

	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: L'Illusionniste<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DBM=
qpU7lUlLg>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image003.jpg at 01CECF22.2B157FB0]

Not to be confused with the 2006 film starring Edward Norton, L'Illusionnis=
te is a 2010 French animated film directed by Sylvain Chomet. The film is b=
ased on an unproduced script by Jacques Tati, a famous French director who =
died in 1982.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director

Philicia Chow, Key Grip

From Noam.Rubin at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct 22 13:54:25 2013
From: Noam.Rubin at students.olin.edu (Noam Rubin)
Date: Tue, 22 Oct 2013 13:54:25 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [HELPYOU] How to manage annoying emails
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_008_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716EXVS01oline_

	boundary="_007_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716EXVS01oline_";
	type="multipart/alternative"

--_007_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B4716EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

A ton of us use Outlook, which has amazing email management tools. Here are=
 some:

If there's a thread you don't care about and don't want to see anymore, rig=
ht click it, and click the "ignore" menu item. Outlook will delete the thre=
ad and every subsequent message to that thread.

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CECF2E.37BF1D00]

If you're getting emails from a specific list or person and it's getting an=
noying, you can make a rule! In your File tab, click the "Rules" menu item:
[cid:image003.jpg at 01CECF2E.37BF1D00]
Here you can quickly make rules that send specific messages somewhere. Let'=
s say I want to send all Announcements to a folder. When you click "Always =
Move Messages From: Announcements", you can select or create a new folder t=
o move the messages to. You can even send them directly to the trash!

There are just some of the tools you can use to manage emails.

Lastly, I want to remind everyone that most emails are just that: emails. A=
n email is only annoying if you give it that much credit. Now go take over =
your inbox!

--Noam

PS I'm sure Gmail has similar tools, I just don't use it. If you do, you sh=
ould reply with your tips!
From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Subhash Gubba
Sent: Tuesday, October 22, 2013 11:31 AM
To: Christopher Mark; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] Who's awake? Who cares?

Make a who's awake mailing list

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.=
edu> [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Christopher Mar=
k
Sent: Tuesday, October 22, 2013 10:50 AM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] Who's awake? Who cares?

The "who's awake" posts were pretty cute the first time around, but it's ge=
tting a little old for some of us.

Is there a better avenue to vent late night frustrations?
Would making a mailing list be more appropriate?

It's getting to be a bit of a clutter in our inboxes, but I know a some peo=
ple appreciate chains of emails like this.

-Chris

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;

nk=3Dpurple><div class=3DWordSection1><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'c=
olor:#1F497D'>A ton of us use Outlook, which has amazing email management t=
ools. Here are some:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=
=3D'color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span s=
tyle=3D'color:#1F497D'>If there&#8217;s a thread you don&#8217;t care about=
 and don&#8217;t want to see anymore, right click it, and click the &#8220;=
ignore&#8221; menu item. Outlook will delete the thread and every subsequen=
t message to that thread.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span s=
tyle=3D'color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><im=
g width=3D257 height=3D279 id=3D"Picture_x0020_1" src=3D"cid:image001.jpg at 0=
1CECF2E.37BF1D00"><span style=3D'color:#1F497D'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p cl=
ass=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><=
p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'color:#1F497D'>If you&#8217;re getting e=
mails from a specific list or person and it&#8217;s getting annoying, you c=
an make a rule! In your File tab, click the &#8220;Rules&#8221; menu item:<=
o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype i=

e_x0020_3"><![endif]><span style=3D'color:#1F497D'><br clear=3Dall><o:p></o=
:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Here you can quickly make rules that sen=
d specific messages somewhere. Let&#8217;s say I want to send all Announcem=
ents to a folder. When you click &#8220;Always Move Messages From: Announce=
ments&#8221;, you can select or create a new folder to move the messages to=
. You can even send them directly to the trash!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMs=
oNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>There are just some of th=
e tools you can use to manage emails.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o=
:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Lastly, I want to remind everyone t=
hat most emails are just that: emails. An email is only annoying if you giv=
e it that much credit. Now go take over your inbox!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=

hould reply with your tips!<span style=3D'color:#1F497D'><o:p></o:p></span>=

From Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu  Tue Oct 22 15:38:24 2013
From: Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu (Adam Coppola)
Date: Tue, 22 Oct 2013 15:38:24 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Weekly Honor Board Meetings
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B47BA@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B47BAEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,
I don't think this has been mentioned before, but the Honor Board weekly me=
etings are open for everyone to attend.
They happen in CC317 (OSL conference room) every Tuesday at 4.
We talk about things that need to get done in the logistics of the Honor Bo=
ard world, and we often have discussion about topics pertaining to honor. T=
hey last between thirty and sixty minutes.
Feel free to stop by today or any Tuesday in the future,
-Adam

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B47BAEXVS01oline_

often have discussion about topics pertaining to honor. They last between t=
hirty and sixty minutes.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Feel free to st=
op by today or any Tuesday in the future,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNorma=
l>-Adam<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A35B47BAEXVS01oline_--

Date: Tue, 22 Oct 2013 22:14:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Friday Service activity - baking cookies for charity
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A28EB7FE@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A28EB7FEEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Oliners!
TLDR: Bake Cookies for SERV
This week's SERV activity is going to be a cookie-baking party to benefit t=
he Tuesday Night Dinner Program in Boston. You don't need to be a good bake=
r to help out! We are going to need about 280, so you should all join in.
What we need YOU for: Email us with what kind of cookies you want to make, =
then come make them! Alternatively, you can sign up in the sous-chef column=
 and help someone else.
What we will give you: We will reimburse you for your ingredients, so you c=
an make tons of fantastic cookies. If you want to be reimbursed, we will ne=
ed a receipt of what you bought.
The plan: You choose a type of cookie you want to bake, and then fill in th=
e spreadsheet with a time you want to bake. Friday will be a day for making=
 the dough, which we will chill until the weekend. Baking will be happening=
 on Sunday, so we deliver them soggy baked goods on Tuesday.  Cookie Spread=
sheet<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Auu9KLwFfDO1dEF1NmM0Vm=
wybEZRem5NU19Odldnc1E#gid=3D0>
Cookie Requirements: Please choose cookies that won't get soggy quickly, an=
d that can take a bit of traveling. Also, try to make normal sized ones (ab=
out 3 inches diameter) so everyone gets a similar amount.
THANKS EVERYONE! See you on in the dorm kitchens. If you have any questions=
, don't hesitate to email me.
~ Amanda (on behalf of SERV)
 PS: I challenge West Hall bakers to beat East Hall bakers, just throwing t=
hat out there...





--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A28EB7FEEXVS01oline_

Hey Carpe,

The Babson Auto Group is holding an auto show this Sunday (Oct 27) in the T=
rim parking lot.  It's free and runs 10AM - 4PM.  Turner Motorsports and To=
y Motorsports are bringing some cars, and there will be a lot of nice stude=
nt cars and off campus cars as well.  If anyone wants to enter their car in=
 the show email me.

-Eerik

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Amanda Sutherland
Sent: Tuesday, October 22, 2013 10:14 PM
To: SERV; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Friday Service activity - baking cookies for charity

Hello Oliners!
TLDR: Bake Cookies for SERV
This week's SERV activity is going to be a cookie-baking party to benefit t=
he Tuesday Night Dinner Program in Boston. You don't need to be a good bake=
r to help out! We are going to need about 280, so you should all join in.
What we need YOU for: Email us with what kind of cookies you want to make, =
then come make them! Alternatively, you can sign up in the sous-chef column=
 and help someone else.
What we will give you: We will reimburse you for your ingredients, so you c=
an make tons of fantastic cookies. If you want to be reimbursed, we will ne=
ed a receipt of what you bought.
The plan: You choose a type of cookie you want to bake, and then fill in th=
e spreadsheet with a time you want to bake. Friday will be a day for making=
 the dough, which we will chill until the weekend. Baking will be happening=
 on Sunday, so we deliver them soggy baked goods on Tuesday.  Cookie Spread=
sheet<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Auu9KLwFfDO1dEF1NmM0Vm=
wybEZRem5NU19Odldnc1E#gid=3D0>
Cookie Requirements: Please choose cookies that won't get soggy quickly, an=
d that can take a bit of traveling. Also, try to make normal sized ones (ab=
out 3 inches diameter) so everyone gets a similar amount.
THANKS EVERYONE! See you on in the dorm kitchens. If you have any questions=
, don't hesitate to email me.
~ Amanda (on behalf of SERV)
 PS: I challenge West Hall bakers to beat East Hall bakers, just throwing t=
hat out there...





--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A28EB804EXVS01oline_

n the sous-chef column and help someone else. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p clas=
s=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'>=
<i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"'>What we will give you=
:</span></i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"'> We will rei=
mburse you for your ingredients, so you can make tons of fantastic cookies.=
 If you want to be reimbursed, we will need a receipt of what you bought. <=
o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;=
mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-s=
erif"'>The plan:</span></i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif=
"'> You choose a type of cookie you want to bake, and then fill in the spre=
adsheet with a time you want to bake. Friday will be a day for making the d=
ough, which we will chill until the weekend. Baking will be happening on Su=
nday, so we deliver them soggy baked goods on Tuesday. &nbsp;<span style=3D=
'color:#4F81BD'><a href=3D"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0A=
uu9KLwFfDO1dEF1NmM0VmwybEZRem5NU19Odldnc1E#gid=3D0"><span style=3D'color:#4=
F81BD'>Cookie Spreadsheet</span></a> </span><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=
=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><=
i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"'>Cookie Requirements:</=
span></i><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"'> Please choose =
cookies that won&#8217;t get soggy quickly, and that can take a bit of trav=
eling. Also, try to make normal sized ones (about 3 inches diameter) so eve=
ryone gets a similar amount. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNorm=
al style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style=
=3D'font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif"'>THANKS EVERYONE! See you on in the =
dorm kitchens. If you have any questions, don&#8217;t hesitate to email me.=
 &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-a=
lt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style=3D'font-family:"Calibri","s=
ans-serif"'>~ Amanda (on behalf of SERV) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DM=
soNormal style=3D'mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span=

ll bakers to beat East Hall bakers, just throwing that out there&#8230;<o:p=

Inviting ingenious individuals in interesting, intellectual improv involvem=
ent.
Supposing select students seek such savvy schemes,

THEME: Glorious Guessing Games
* Please prepare pleasantly preposterous pun packs per presumption points
* Also allowing awesomely atrocious alliteration, and as always, attendance=
 at Auditorium

Wishing well worked Wednesdays,

-          Maleficent Me

for rest of semester, though feel free to ignore obvious holidays. If you w=
ant updates/to mock my attempts to be entertaining - sign up for mailing li=
st: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/olimprov *

From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Wed, 23 Oct 2013 12:53:03 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Crash Course to Programming Languages!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729B3E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I was informed non-first years would be interested in this.

From: Kai Austin
Sent: Tuesday, October 22, 2013 12:45 AM
To: Students - Class of 2017
Subject: Crash Course to Programming Languages! (OIE credit)

Still need OIE credit? (because - you never know!)
New to the whole programming world? Hate coding? Want to make a website but=
 do not know where to begin?

Then come to:
Crash Course to Programming Languages! What the what?
(aka: What I wish I knew when I was 17 and Babson students keep asking me a=
bout)
8:30pm, October 24th, 2013 in AC113

After I beat all your SIBBs with the tallest cupcake in Candy Crush, head o=
ver to the AC for a crash course overview to the different languages such a=
s: Java, Python, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, MySQL, MongoDB, HTML, CSS, PHP, Lisp,=
 Javascript, APIs, etc. What makes them different? What makes them to same?=
 Which ones are relevant to what you may want to learn? Are there any short=
cuts? Find out where to begin if you want to make a website, an app, a mobi=
le app, a game, an AI, or just an all around program which is not MatLab. N=
o, I am not teaching you to code. But I will show you (almost) everything a=
bout it. And fast. British accent and poetry upon request.

PLEASE RSVP IF YOU WANT TO COME!

(or just show - I initially wanted a general idea of how many were coming)

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729B3EEXVS01oline_

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle18
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

ascript, APIs, etc. What makes them different? What makes them to same? Whi=
ch ones are relevant to what you may want to learn? Are there any shortcuts=
? Find out where to begin if you want to make a website, an app, a mobile a=
pp, a game, an AI, or just an all around program which is not MatLab. No, I=
 am not teaching you to code. But I will show you (almost) everything about=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729C1FEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey there!

Olin's curriculum is being reviewed.  And students should be involved.  Thi=
s is a first stab at getting a feel for student opinions, and there will ot=
her opportunities coming.  The Review Committee would like to know - what d=
o you think of what's going on here?  Is Olin meeting your expectations, fa=
lling short, exceeding?  What would you change?  Why?

Please, take a moment and complete this survey: https://docs.google.com/for=
ms/d/1abwCy8Xuf8_NGiDmMdenOl7zeGscQN4N1lB0VXpBEDc/viewform

If you would be interested in chatting curriculum, shoot me an email!  I'd =
be happy to answer any questions, and discuss what's going on.  I'm trying =
to represent students on the committee, and I can't do that if I don't know=
 what you think.

Thanks carpe!

V

Sign ups will be Thursday and Friday from 12:30 to 1:30. 40 people maximum

From Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu  Wed Oct 23 19:29:10 2013
From: Adam.Coppola at students.olin.edu (Adam Coppola)
Date: Wed, 23 Oct 2013 19:29:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Dine with Honor
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729DDD@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729DDDEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729DDDEXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729DDDEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tl;dr come eat lunch with us and chat about honor, Friday during lunch on t=
he mezz.

Last year the Honor Code Review Committee held dinners and stuff that got a=
 lot of people talking about honor.
We want to do that again, except this time, we don't have the goal of revie=
wing the Honor Code. Instead, we just want to talk about honor, the Honor C=
ode, what it means to the Olin community, and anything we'd like to see the=
 Honor Board accomplish this year. It's going to be informal, so come on up=
 to the mezz this Friday to hang out with us.

-Adam and the Honor Board


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A3729DDDEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/html; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

of people talking about honor. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>We want =
to do that again, except this time, we don&#8217;t have the goal of reviewi=
ng the Honor Code. Instead, we just want to talk about honor, the Honor Cod=
e, what it means to the Olin community, and anything we&#8217;d like to see=
 the Honor Board accomplish this year. It&#8217;s going to be informal, so =
come on up to the mezz this Friday to hang out with us.<o:p></o:p></p><p cl=

From Amanda.Sutherland at students.olin.edu  Thu Oct 24 03:14:20 2013
From: Amanda.Sutherland at students.olin.edu (Amanda Sutherland)
Date: Thu, 24 Oct 2013 03:14:20 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] PSA: skunk on campus
Message-ID: <201564B9-16CB-441D-867B-2F2F4E928381@students.olin.edu>

As of 3 this morning, Olin has a skunk hanging around the dorms. It is a beautiful creature, but be very careful of scaring it or we will have an extremely smelly campus. Let it get out of your way and don't approach it. 

Love,
Your early morning nature woman

We'll be going to Fox 4 Paintball, a woodsball course. For $25 you rent equ=

Sign ups will be Thursday and Friday from 12:30 to 1:30. 40 people maximum

tballs. If you have your own equipment, bring that too. Sign ups will be Th=
ursday and Friday from 12:30 to 1:30. 40 people maximum <o:p></o:p></p></di=
v></body></html>=

I just junked my car and I now have some car items of value but no car to p=
ut them in. I thought I'd try to sell to Oliners before going to ebay/craig=
slist/whatever. All prices are negotiable since I'd prefer to sell to peopl=
e I know. (I got original estimates from finding these same items for sale =
online.)

-Sony CDX-GT33W stereo: $50

-Fusion RE-AM45020 450 watt amp: $50

-Fusion RE-PK1120 subwoofer: $300

-2 all-season tires (Radial LL600 M S 195/60R15 88T) : $90  (definitely neg=
otiable if you want to come check out the treads)

-12ft, 10gauge jumper cables: $10

-car jack: $20

-1.5qt multi-vehicle transmission fluid: $5

-almost 12oz DOT 3 brake fluid: $3

-1qt high mileage 10W-30 part synthetic motor oil: $5

-ice scraper with warm glove attached, awesome for winter: $5

-ice scraper: $5

-brush/scraper combo (part of scraper is broken but it still works): $3

-Air freshener. Do you miss Tim Raymond? Do you miss the "black ice" smell =
of his car? Well lucky for you he kept a precious spare in the glove compar=
tment. Free.

Let me know if you're interested in anything or if you want to take a look =
at stuff.

Kate

From Announcements at olin.edu  Thu Oct 24 11:47:36 2013
From: Announcements at olin.edu (Announcements)
Date: Thu, 24 Oct 2013 11:47:36 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] KPCB Engineering & Product Fellows Program -
 Applications due on ONE WEEK!
Message-ID: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476CE8598500E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476CE8598500EEXVS01olinedu_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This is just a quick reminder that the Engineering Fellows and new year-lon=
g Product Fellows Program applications close in about a week. I reached out=
 about three weeks ago and provided some information that you can use to sh=
are with your student, but I hope that this e-mail could serve as a reminde=
r to help spread the news about the program! I've included that original in=
formation below.

One point of clarification is student eligibility. The Engineering Fellows =
Program is a summer program, and so we are primarily looking for students w=
ho will return to school after the summer. For the year long Product Fellow=
s Program, we will only accept students who will graduate in 2014. We belie=
ve the Product Program should be a very interesting program for business sc=
hools students who are interested in product management roles.

Also, since the last time I e-mailed, there have been some great articles t=
alking about the engineering and new product program. Particularly interest=
ing was the Fast Company Article:

http://www.fastcompany.com/3019060/fast-feed/kleiner-perkins-launches-fello=
ws-program-to-attract-young-product-managers

And also an article by Rice University on Salvatore Testa, a 2013 Engineeri=
ng Fellow:

http://engineering.rice.edu/KPCB_testa/

To help share this program with your students, you can use the content belo=
w, or also retweet from our twitter: http://www.twitter.com/kpcbfellows or =
"like" our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/kpcbfellows


E-mail for KPCB Fellows Program

Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers (www.kpcb.com<http://www.kpcb.com>), a wor=
ld-leading venture capital firm located in Silicon Valley, announced that t=
hey are accepting applications for the 2014 KPCB Engineering and Product Fe=
llows Program and we'd like to share this opportunity with you. Please note=
 that the deadline for submissions is on October 31, 2013.

Website: http://www.kpcbfellows.com/

The KPCB Fellows Program offers top U.S. college and graduate students a ch=
ance to work inside innovative Silicon Valley startups. The three-month sum=
mer program is focused on engineering. A new year-long program is focused o=
n product management.

The goal of the Fellows Program is for students to gain significant experie=
nce working on some of the most unique and challenging engineering and prod=
uct problems, and to develop new relationships that are meaningful to their=
 careers.

Over the course of a summer, KPCB Engineering Fellows will be employed at a=
 KPCB portfolio company, where they can develop their technical skills and =
be mentored by an executive within the company. Participants in the new Pro=
duct Fellows Program will get the chance to spend a full year working at a =
Valley startup.

Fellows will also be invited to attend both private events held by KPCB and=
 others hosted by portfolio companies, where they can meet other talented e=
ngineering and design students, network with luminaries in their respective=
 fields, and explore the San Francisco Bay Area.

To ensure that Fellows have the best possible experience during the summer,=
 the program will accept only a limited number of top applicants.

The application period for the summer 2014 KPCB Engineering Fellows Program=
 and year long Product Fellows Program opened on October 3, 2013. The deadl=
ine for submissions is 11:59 pm PDT on October 31, 2013.

Website: http://www.kpcbfellows.com/

You can also find out more at http://www.twitter.com/kpcbfellows or their F=
acebook page at http://www.facebook.com/kpcbfellows



___________________________

Andy Chen
Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers
Linkedin:atchen<http://www.linkedin.com/in/atchen/>
Twitter:@andychen<http://www.twitter.com/andychen>

2750 Sand Hill Road
Menlo Park, CA 94025
650-233-3426 (voice)
650-233-0300 (fax)
www.kpcb.com<http://www.kpcb.com/>


--_000_74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476CE8598500EEXVS01olinedu_

(Now with added only sending this survey out once!)

Slater

From jialiya.huang at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 25 15:45:21 2013
From: jialiya.huang at students.olin.edu (Jialiya Huang)
Date: Fri, 25 Oct 2013 15:45:21 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Node/C contract project ($200)
Message-ID: <CAKBPkNBGxaeQnTKMR-PYgTWVouRHhfgPhyoB5Yv2dxDVnuYMmg@mail.gmail.com>

--047d7b66f2f7a4986f04e995fd6e
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey Oliners,

Here is a self-contained Node.js project that we=92re willing to hire an
Oliner for its completion.

Needs: A Linux or OSX computer (Windows if you=92re clever)
Skills: Node.js and C
License: Ultimately MIT licensed in a few months, IP owned by us (Technical
Machine)

You=92ll be porting the FatFS and PetitFatFS file systems to JavaScript. Th=
is
comes in three parts:

1. Testing PetitFatFS from your OS. ($25, 2 hours)

To use http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/00index_p.html, you need three functions:
disk_initialize, disk_readp, disk_writep. We=92re going to give you a .img
file, basically a raw FAT filesystem. Your goal is to make a small C
program that implements those functions to read/write from this .img file
(it=92s very straightforward, you=92ll have to look up sector size). Then m=
ake
a tiny main() that reads out what files are inside of the .img file, writes
to a file, and reads back its contents. (Your test rig)

2. Porting PetitFatFS to Node.js ($75, 5 hours)

This one is fun. http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/00index_p.html is two files of
C code. We need it ported to Node.js in its entirely. You=92ll be using the
Node.js fs class to load the .img file, then the Buffer class to do the
file manipulation you=92d be doing in C. Run the same tests as in step 1 to
prove that everything works, then run the C version to prove they=92re
interoperable. If you've never done a C -> JS port, here's an example of a
C library: https://github.com/jjalling/Arduino-Si7005/blob/master/Si7005.cp=
pand
the JS version of it:
https://github.com/technicalmachine/climate-si7005/blob/97bb1162db99bc20c52=
c3c6669869eb297e8b7dd/index.js.
At the lowest level you just go through and change all the methods to
"function" and all the typedefs to "var". Once that works you can make it
more Node-like by adding in callbacks where it makes sense. You can check
the evolution of the climate code if you want to see how this works.

3. Porting FatFS to Node.js ($150, 10? hours)

PetitFatFS is tiny and has fewer features, FatFS
http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/00index_e.html is fully-featured and larger. We
want a port of this to Node.js, implementing as many features as possible
from the original C. We=92ll want some test cases like the other examples t=
o
prove this port works. This would replace the PetitFatFS port once it works=
.

We'd like it done by Nov 8th (either one or several parts). Let us know if
you're interested and we can give more info.

Thanks,
Jia

--047d7b66f2f7a4986f04e995fd6e
Content-Type: text/html; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu  Fri Oct 25 17:00:43 2013
From: Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu (Elizabeth Fitzpatrick)
Date: Fri, 25 Oct 2013 17:00:43 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Sit and Knit!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello!
I sent out an email last week about knitting club. I'm planning on holding =
a Sit & Knit event tomorrow afternoon from 3-5.

Q: What's a Sit & Knit?
A: It's a chance for you to hang out with Oliners and knit/crochet/etc. whi=
le watching a movie or tv show.

Q: What if I don't have any materials?
A: Don't  worry! We have a ton of needles and yarn.

Q: What if I don't know how to knit or crochet?
A: We can teach you! :)

Q: Where will this take place?
A: Most likely EH1 (that's where the supplies are at the moment) but subjec=
t to being moved if something else is happening there.

Hope to see you there! If you show up earlyish, you'll have a say in what w=
e watch. But you can also drop in at any time. :)
~Liz

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61EXVS01oline_

Dearest injuns and other friends,****

** **

This *Saturday night* we shall enjoy one another=92s company and get down
with the brown while making some chaat. What dafuq is that, you ask? Click
here to find out! <http://lmgtfy.com/?q=3Dchaat>****

** **

Considering that there are many first-years that we haven=92t met, we=92re
going to *cook in the* *West Hall Kitchen from 7:30 to 9:00* and *dine in
West Hall from 9:00 to 10:00*. **

** **

You should come the chaat making session! You=92ll get to interact with me,=
 a
certified dumbass, and Aman, the man responsible for 50% of all Dominoes
orders. Seriously, we=92re going to watch classics like You kicked my
dog!?<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dg9fIjYnPazc>
 and How can she slap!? <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DJF8M6ggJkBE>****

** **


See you on Saturday night!****

Shivam and Aman****

** **

P.S. We love to buy things that are on sale****

P.S.S. Seriously, Aman bought so much chutney last year that Adit and
Saarth had to pour a full pot (yes, you read that correctly - A POT FULL OF
CHUTNEY) down the drain=85

Tl;dr: if you're potentially interested in starting up a chapter, let me kn=
ow.

>From one of Facilities' connections:
"Have you heard of the Association for Facilities and Engineering (AFE)? - =
www.afechapter33.org<http://www.afechapter33.org>

You might have interest in joining or attending some of the facility tours =
and we are looking to establish a student membership for our chapter.  AFE =
is a great fit for Olin College students looking for contacts and would act=
 as a job lead source thru exposure to facility management teams and engine=
ers all over the Greater Boston Area."

From Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu  Sat Oct 26 15:10:00 2013
From: Elizabeth.Fitzpatrick at students.olin.edu (Elizabeth Fitzpatrick)
Date: Sat, 26 Oct 2013 15:10:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Sit and Knit!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40130A38A8C61@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40131A2A02F47@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40131A2A02F47EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Happening now! (And by "happening" I mean "sorting through all of the knitt=
ing supplies." But you should still come!)

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Elizabeth Fitzpatrick
Sent: Friday, October 25, 2013 5:01 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Sit and Knit!

Hello!
I sent out an email last week about knitting club. I'm planning on holding =
a Sit & Knit event tomorrow afternoon from 3-5.

Q: What's a Sit & Knit?
A: It's a chance for you to hang out with Oliners and knit/crochet/etc. whi=
le watching a movie or tv show.

Q: What if I don't have any materials?
A: Don't  worry! We have a ton of needles and yarn.

Q: What if I don't know how to knit or crochet?
A: We can teach you! :)

Q: Where will this take place?
A: Most likely EH1 (that's where the supplies are at the moment) but subjec=
t to being moved if something else is happening there.

Hope to see you there! If you show up earlyish, you'll have a say in what w=
e watch. But you can also drop in at any time. :)
~Liz

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40131A2A02F47EXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle18
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
span.EmailStyle19
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

ve 3 spots in the car and will be leaving now-ish, and be getting back at 4=
-ish. SoWa is a giant venue with local artisan crafts, food trucks, and a h=
onkin' large farmer's market.

Email back if you want to go.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E534CEXVS01oline_
