I=92m placing a sushi order at 6:15 to get here at 7PM. Any rolls costs =
$7 TOTAL, this includes tax and delivery! Drop off cash beforehand =
outside EH1NE so I can pay the delivery person.

Pickup will be from EH1 at 7:00 and I'll send an email when it's here. =
Pick any rolls from the following menu:

=97=97 Menu =97 =97=20

M1: Cucumber, Avocado or Asparagus Maki

M2: Oshinko Maki
Japanese pickles

M3: Mango Maki
Mango and cucumber

M4: AAC Maki
Asparagus, avocado, cucumber

M5: Triple A Maki
Asparagus, apple, avocado

M6: Tempura Shiitake Mushroom Maki
with unagi sauce

M7: Idaho Maki
Deep fried sweet yam with unagi sauce

M8: Sweet Maki
Inari, cucumber, tamago

M9: Vegetarian Futo Maki
Inari, tamago, cucumber, avocado, Oshinko

M10: Celtics Maki
Avocado, tempura sweet yam, tobiko, yuzu miso sauce and berries

M11: Tekka Maki
Tuna

M12: Sake Maki
Salmon

M13: Negi-Hama Maki
Yellowtail with scallions

M14: Tuna and Avocado Maki

M15: Spicy Tuna Maki / Spicy White Tuna Maki
Tuna or white tuna, tempura flakes, scallion and spicy mayo

M16: Spicy Salmon Maki
Salmon, cucumber, spicy mayo

M17: Mackerel Maki
Pickled Mackerel, cucumber, ginger, jalapeno, and scallion

M18: Alaskan Maki
Salmon and avocado

M19: Philadelphia Maki
Smoked salmon, cucumber, scallions and cream cheese

M20: Spicy Scallop Maki
Scallop, tobiko, cucumber, spicy mayo

M21: Rising Sun Maki
Salmon, cucumber, avocado, tempura flakes, spicy mayo

M22: California Maki
Crab stick, cucumber, avocado and tobiko

M23: Classic California Maki
Real crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and tobiko

M24: Harmony Maki
Baked fish, cucumber, avocado, scallions, sriracha sauce

M25: Tempura White Tuna Maki
with unagi sauce

M26: Unagi Maki
Eel w/ cucumber OR avocado with unagi sauce

M27: Shrimp with Avocado Maki

M28: Baked Salmon and Avocado Maki

M29: Spicy Shrimp and Mango Maki

M30: Crazy Maki
Shrimp tempura, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, and spicy mayo

M31: Shrimp Tempura Maki
Shrimp Tempura, unagi sauce and tobiko

M32: Soft Shell Crab Maki
Soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, unagi sauce and spicy mayo

M33: Salmon Monster Jr. Maki
Baked salmon, crab stick, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, scallions, spicy =
creamy sauce

Maki</div><div><br></div><div>M28: Baked Salmon and Avocado =
Maki</div><div><br></div><div>M29: Spicy Shrimp and Mango =
Maki</div><div><br></div><div>M30: Crazy Maki</div><div>Shrimp tempura, =
cucumber, avocado, tobiko, and spicy mayo</div><div><br></div><div>M31: =
Shrimp Tempura Maki</div><div>Shrimp Tempura, unagi sauce and =
tobiko</div><div><br></div><div>M32: Soft Shell Crab Maki</div><div>Soft =

mayo</div><div><br></div><div>M33: Salmon Monster Jr. =

> TOTAL*, this includes tax and delivery! Drop off cash beforehand outside
> EH1NE so I can pay the delivery person.
>
> Pickup will be from EH1 at 7:00 and I'll send an email when it's here.
> Pick any rolls from the following menu:
>
> =97=97 Menu =97 =97

>

> Asparagus, apple, avocado
>

> with unagi sauce

> Deep fried sweet yam with unagi sauce
>

> Inari, cucumber, tamago
>
> M9: Vegetarian Futo Maki
> Inari, tamago, cucumber, avocado, Oshinko
>

> Avocado, tempura sweet yam, tobiko, yuzu miso sauce and berries
>

> Tuna

> M12: Sake Maki
> Salmon
>
> M13: Negi-Hama Maki
> Yellowtail with scallions
>

>
> M15: Spicy Tuna Maki / Spicy White Tuna Maki
> Tuna or white tuna, tempura flakes, scallion and spicy mayo
>
> M16: Spicy Salmon Maki
> Salmon, cucumber, spicy mayo
>
> M17: Mackerel Maki
> Pickled Mackerel, cucumber, ginger, jalapeno, and scallion
>
> M18: Alaskan Maki
> Salmon and avocado
>
> M19: Philadelphia Maki
> Smoked salmon, cucumber, scallions and cream cheese
>
> M20: Spicy Scallop Maki
> Scallop, tobiko, cucumber, spicy mayo
>
> M21: Rising Sun Maki
> Salmon, cucumber, avocado, tempura flakes, spicy mayo
>
> M22: California Maki
> Crab stick, cucumber, avocado and tobiko
>
> M23: Classic California Maki
> Real crab meat, cucumber, avocado, and tobiko
>
> M24: Harmony Maki
> Baked fish, cucumber, avocado, scallions, sriracha sauce
>
> M25: Tempura White Tuna Maki
> with unagi sauce
>
> M26: Unagi Maki
> Eel w/ cucumber OR avocado with unagi sauce
>
> M27: Shrimp with Avocado Maki
>
> M28: Baked Salmon and Avocado Maki
>
> M29: Spicy Shrimp and Mango Maki
>
> M30: Crazy Maki
> Shrimp tempura, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, and spicy mayo
>
> M31: Shrimp Tempura Maki
> Shrimp Tempura, unagi sauce and tobiko
>
> M32: Soft Shell Crab Maki
> Soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, unagi sauce and spicy mayo
>
> M33: Salmon Monster Jr. Maki
> Baked salmon, crab stick, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, scallions, spicy
> creamy sauce
>
> tcr / 2013.5 / eh1ne
>

--001a11c2fda8ca072f04e9c03e83
Content-Type: text/html; charset="windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Dearest members of Carpe Diem,

We, the gentlemen of suite 3W, are proud to announce that in a fit of drunk=
en rage, we accidently threw out our wonderful bowl of raffle entrants from=
 Suite and Greet.

Therefore, in honor of our dearest Dumbass KG$'s birthday, one of you magni=
ficent humans will get the opportunity to enjoy
3 half gallon cartons of one month old orange juice!!!

Third person to reply gets them!

Yours truthfully,
ShamWOW/She-bang

Dearest all,

We, the gentlemen of suite 3W, are proud to announce that we have a winner =
of the 3 half gallon cartons of one month old orange juice!!!

Please everyone congratulate my dearest SiBB, Adam "SUCKS" Coppola!!

Adam just won 3 whole cartons of premium aged orange juice. To satisfy your=
 midnight thirsties, he's the one to seek out.

Thank you to all who responded and tried their luck at the reposado oj... T=
o all who didn't win, don't fret. We plan on doing surprise contests in the=
 future and you could be the lucky winner of the day's prize!

On behalf of Dumbass suite (Kris, John, Travis, Ken, Shivam, and Steven), I=
 wish you all another continued good night.

Yours for the next year,
ShamWEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

I think this survey is improperly written, because it takes absolutely no a=
ccount for the position that people have no interest in removing meat from =
their diet. I consider meat to be a very important part of my meal, and thi=
nk the idea of removing it is as terrible as you would find removing all no=
n-meat options from the menu.

Thanks,
                -Murphy

If you are not interested in meatless Mondays, simply answer "no" on the su=
rvey and write your comments in the "why" section.
Seems like there's a good answer choice for everyone, especially since ther=
e's an open comment box.
The point of this survey is (or seems to be) to see whether a large portion=
 of the student body would be interested or not.
~Molly

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Murphy Kitchell
Sent: Sunday, October 27, 2013 11:12 PM
To: David Pudlo; helpme at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] [Survey] 10 second survey!

I think this survey is improperly written, because it takes absolutely no a=
ccount for the position that people have no interest in removing meat from =
their diet. I consider meat to be a very important part of my meal, and thi=
nk the idea of removing it is as terrible as you would find removing all no=
n-meat options from the menu.

Thanks,
                -Murphy

@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

Openness to change / respect, everyone.

I would like policy-related emails to be better labeled in the future, I
wouldn't have read this survey unless someone pointed out its contents to
me. If we're suggesting Carpediem policy, I'd like to call attention to
informing students ahead of time what surveys are intended to be used for,
under *any* circumstances (even just casual interest)

Tim

From David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 28 00:51:38 2013
From: David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu (David Pudlo)
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 2013 00:51:38 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [Survey] 10 second survey!
In-Reply-To: <3FFAD341-665E-4DBB-B357-3DBC43188E69@students.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E573C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I would like to strongly repeat Tim's call, especially for respect. I would=
 argue that some of the previous emails have overstepped the bounds of resp=
ectful discussion. I think that replying all with some of the content has b=
een unnecessary and rash. I have tried to address some of the concerns addr=
essed below. Please come talk to me personally if you have any concerns. I =
am trying to be as open as possible here.

For those concerned about list policy:
The survey was unlabeled to prevent a sampling bias where people who feel v=
ery strongly about a topic are the only ones who respond. We were hoping to=
 get the middle ground of people who don't care much either way. I was awar=
e of this being done before, and didn't know it was an issue. I'm certainly=
 open to list policy discussion, though more reply all thread are probably =
not the best mechanism.

For those concerned about the survey style:
                I tried to leave the survey very open to any views (a yes, =
no, and maybe, with an entirely open why). If you have any issues with my s=
urvey, please email me directly.

For those concerned about their voices being heard:
                This is part of an initiative of GrOW to make Olin a more s=
ustainable place, and to make the food offered in the dining hall more sust=
ainable. We were not planning on simply demanding meatless days, and we are=
 gauging student opinion. We are planning on tabling this Tuesday and Thurs=
day (during the lunch hours) to field how people feel as well as inform the=
m of our side of the coin. We do intend this to be a discussion.

Trying to make the world a more sustainable place is a huge priority for an=
d several others here on campus. We see this as a significant way to reduce=
 our impact, livestock alone accounts for between 9 and 18% of our Greenhou=
se gas emissions 1<http://www.fao.org/ag/magazine/0612sp1.htm> 2<http://www=
.sciencedaily.com/releases/2007/02/070220145244.htm>, not to mention a larg=
e number of other negative environmental impacts associated with the curren=
t food system. Reducing the amount of meat eaten is a quick and (in my opin=
ion) easy way to reduce our current impact.

Thanks,
-David

PS: To the people cussing and attacking me personally in the comments secti=
on, that was unnecessary.

ing students ahead of time what surveys are intended to be used for, under =
*any* circumstances (even just casual interest)

Tim

rvey and write your comments in the "why" section.
Seems like there's a good answer choice for everyone, especially since ther=
e's an open comment box.
The point of this survey is (or seems to be) to see whether a large portion=
 of the student body would be interested or not.
~Molly

ccount for the position that people have no interest in removing meat from =
their diet. I consider meat to be a very important part of my meal, and thi=

n-meat options from the menu.

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 28 08:57:18 2013
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 2013 08:57:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem]  [Policy]
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E59ED@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E59EDEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tl;dr: Email list policy. Discuss.

In case anybody read my Frankly Speaking Article from a few months ago, or =
otherwise remember that I sent out a survey long ago about list policy, I h=
ave that raw data here (Also, the mean, standard deviation, and 5-number su=
mmary are at the bottom):
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0AlFIfAVxWQyhdGQzNHhTTm5xWjVF=
bjUxdDA0YmoydkE&usp=3Dsharing

Basically, having a list policy discussion is very difficult, because peopl=
e have a HUGE variety of opinions. On many of the 'rate the appropriateness=
' questions, the range of answers was huge (often 0 to 10), and the interqu=
artile range often high. If you read some of the comments (at least one of =
which is quite rude), people's opinions rarely match. As we found with rewr=
iting the Honor Code last year, getting people to agree on anything, especi=
ally anything this far-reaching and impactful on our daily lives, is a herc=
ulean task.

My solution? Write the kind of emails that you would like to see (For examp=
le, this was originally a reply-all to David Pudlo's last email, but I deci=
ded that it may have warranted its own thread).

THIS ALL BEING SAID, we should probably have a discussion of list policy at=
 some point. The reason I took this survey and wrote the FS article and ult=
imately this email was because I felt that our list policy was largely unde=
fined, and that generating a set of acceptable use parameters that the comm=
unity agrees upon is the best course of action (Some people want the policy=
 to be no policy at all, and that's totally fine too. They should especiall=
y participate in this discussion). So think hard about what you want to see=
 these lists be, where they fall short, and how they're already totally awe=
some. And then talk about it with someone. I've felt a decent amount of ema=
il rage this year, and if we work together to figure out what exactly we wa=
nt, we can minimize that anger.

That discussion does not have to happen over email, and probably shouldn't,=
 to avoid spamming Carpe/helpme/whatever is the appropriate discussion venu=
e for this.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E59EDEXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From Daniel.Kearney at students.olin.edu  Mon Oct 28 15:20:17 2013
From: Daniel.Kearney at students.olin.edu (Daniel Kearney)
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 2013 15:20:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] New Jersey club
In-Reply-To: <41A58B09-3C2E-4A04-8455-38F9D49F729D@students.olin.edu>
References: <41A58B09-3C2E-4A04-8455-38F9D49F729D@students.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133633E5CA1@EXVS01.olin.edu>

UPDATE!

To broaden our group, we've decided to expand New Jersey club to Tri-State-Area club.  Did your dad work in New York? Do you live near a train station? Are you from a preppy high school/ have a rival prep school? Want to help in the quest against Idaho? Join Tri-State-Area club! 

<3
Dan

Hi Folks,
Please consider attending the Masterworks Chorale's Performance " Mozart vs=
 Salieri".  Featuring the Mozart Requiem and the Salieri Grand Mass, Friday=
 November 15th at 8PM.  Sanders Theatre, Harvard University.   Student rush=
 tickets  5$ at the door.

    * Top-tier soloists
    * Professional Orchestra
    * Free Parking
    * Harvard Square Dining Specials for concert patrons at Sandrine's Bist=
ro & Grafton Street Pub
            [detailed in press release]
    * Ticket prices as low as $25
    * $5 student rush tickets one hour prior to the performance,
            as available.
Rebecca

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Do you want to do Zumba at Olin?!? We have the opportunity to bring a Zumba=
 instructor to campus to teach once or twice a week (Most likely Wednesdays=
). If you're interested in making this happen please sign-up in the dining =
hall (Nick Tatar wants a physical sign-up sheet to show proof of interest b=
efore we start paying someone). If you think your friends would be interest=
ed in this remind them to sign up too!

Thanks!

p.s. I'd be grateful if someone could forward this to the dance clubs on ca=
mpus as I am not a member.

As a member of the Tri-State-Area club, I approve this description and
would like to add that you are invited to join if:

   - your hometown has a cute white gazebo on the town green
   - your friend group is annually split down the middle between Sox and
   Yankees fans

- Derek

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Escape From Tomorrow<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=
=3D1nfU_5NWBoE\>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CED49A.701E5050]

Since it's Halloween week I decided to show a more appropriately themed mov=
ie and so I have chosen Escape From Tomorrow. This film is particularly int=
eresting because it was shot mostly on location at Walt Disney World and Di=
sneyland without permission from The Walt Disney Company. This is a fantasy=
-psychological film directed by Randy Moore and is entirely in black and wh=
ite.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, 104 Minute Run Time
Shivam Desai, Chicken Nuggets
Philicia Chow, The Sessions Next Week


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013363E836FDEXVS01oline_

Hey Carpe,
I'm sorry for posting the rude meme in response to the survey. At the time =
I thought it was a lighthearted joke but I've realized it was mean and disp=
araging towards valid opinions about green initiatives. Next time I'll do a=
 better job filtering myself and if you want to talk to me about negative r=
esponses to my post, I'm always down to talk.
Nathan

On Oct 28, 2013, at 12:51 AM, David Pudlo <David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu<ma=
ilto:David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

I would like to strongly repeat Tim=92s call, especially for respect. I wou=
ld argue that some of the previous emails have overstepped the bounds of re=
spectful discussion. I think that replying all with some of the content has=
 been unnecessary and rash. I have tried to address some of the concerns ad=
dressed below. Please come talk to me personally if you have any concerns. =
I am trying to be as open as possible here.

For those concerned about list policy:
The survey was unlabeled to prevent a sampling bias where people who feel v=
ery strongly about a topic are the only ones who respond. We were hoping to=
 get the middle ground of people who don=92t care much either way. I was aw=
are of this being done before, and didn=92t know it was an issue. I=92m cer=
tainly open to list policy discussion, though more reply all thread are pro=
bably not the best mechanism.

For those concerned about the survey style:
                I tried to leave the survey very open to any views (a yes, =
no, and maybe, with an entirely open why). If you have any issues with my s=
urvey, please email me directly.

For those concerned about their voices being heard:
                This is part of an initiative of GrOW to make Olin a more s=
ustainable place, and to make the food offered in the dining hall more sust=
ainable. We were not planning on simply demanding meatless days, and we are=
 gauging student opinion. We are planning on tabling this Tuesday and Thurs=
day (during the lunch hours) to field how people feel as well as inform the=
m of our side of the coin. We do intend this to be a discussion.

Trying to make the world a more sustainable place is a huge priority for an=
d several others here on campus. We see this as a significant way to reduce=
 our impact, livestock alone accounts for between 9 and 18% of our Greenhou=
se gas emissions 1<http://www.fao.org/ag/magazine/0612sp1.htm> 2<http://www=
.sciencedaily.com/releases/2007/02/070220145244.htm>, not to mention a larg=
e number of other negative environmental impacts associated with the curren=
t food system. Reducing the amount of meat eaten is a quick and (in my opin=
ion) easy way to reduce our current impact.

Thanks,
-David

PS: To the people cussing and attacking me personally in the comments secti=
on, that was unnecessary.

ccount for the position that people have no interest in removing meat from =
their diet. I consider meat to be a very important part of my meal, and thi=
nk the idea of removing it is as terrible as you would find removing all no=
n-meat options from the menu.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Everyone,

My suite misplaced a Mrs. Potatohead a while ago. You might have seen her w=
andering around outside of east hall, looking a little forlorn. We do not w=
ant her back. However, if you have her and want some of her clothes, we'd b=
e happy to provide.

Alternatively, if you have a Potatohead person and want some hand-me-downs =
from Suite Yo'self, we'd love to have them go to a better place.

Thanks,
Evelyn

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133641812B7EXVS01oline_

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi friends,

I will be playing video games this November 2nd. What makes that day differ=
ent is that I'll be playing in honor of kids who are in hospitals, who are =
quite frankly having a pretty sucky time. Some of them are suffering throug=
h things that would make your skin crawl, life threatening illnesses, cance=
r... It's scary stuff. I hope to raise money for Boston Children's Hospital=
, and will be playing for 25 hours straight to do so. If you want to suppor=
t, please donate today through the link here, it gets tracked and I can see=
 how much I've raised. Thanks~ : http://www.extra-life.org/index.cfm?fuseac=
tion=3Ddonordrive.participant&participantID=3D56969


If you want to join the Olin Team, please hit up this link: http://www.extr=
a-life.org/index.cfm?fuseaction=3DdonorDrive.team&teamID=3D12584
And shoot me an email so we can meet up and plan our day of play!


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40133641815C1EXVS01oline_
